Reviews.Title: “Elegant but dated”
Reviews.Author: Lisa J
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Hotel in Madrid has lovely common spaces and some of the rooms are very nice. However, the small details that one normally expects from a luxury hotel were missing on a recent stay. The first room offered reminded me of a new york city studio apartment with a poor layout and was far too small for a couple. The second room offered was much better but with twin beds that could only be brought together by rearranging the furniture. The hotel does not offer newspapers; the rooms lack full length mirrors and our room did not have a book of the services on offer at the hotel. Internet charges are 20 euros unless you sign up for the priority rewards program. Housekeeping forgot to leave shampoo or change the glasses in the bathroom. Small details make for a nice stay. Intercontinental would be very nice if it paid closer attention to the details.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: sanblue
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, Made us happy.!! Convenient location, great, friendly staff, fantastic bar/lounge. Good food. Very clean, comfortable rooms. Perfect stay!! Everything was great! great value for money. The staff were always willing to help on all enquiries, wether it was regarding changing rooms, enquiring re restaurants, taxi, metro other tourist attractions, booking tickets etc. Restaurant/bar tenders very courteous & friendly. Hotel was immaculately clean & fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: JAWhitfield
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, very close to the metro, and walking distance to many sights. The staff was friendly and the rooms are clean, but small. We had a double which was two twin beds pushed together. It was fine for our short, two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesleyL50
Reviews.Content: have just come back from a 3 nght stay at this hotel with my husband. I found all the staff to be helpful and friendly. Our room was lovely with a nice big bathroom. I cannot comment on the the food as we decided the hotel was far too expensive at 9 euros for half a grapefruit! for breakfast. There were plenty of nice resturants and tapas bars around the surrounding area of the hotel. It is also cose to the metro so is a good base for travelling around Madrid. Would definately stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “five star service all around”
Reviews.Author: middy c
Reviews.Content: On arrival the porters opened the door to our taxi and immediately took charge of our luggage, we were expected, we check in with out any delay. we were ushered to our room which was a standard double room but very impressive. There was a kettle with coffee and tea for our convenience. The breakfast was more than adequate with lots of choices of fruits, bread, meats etc. The loung was beautiful and the location was not far from the real madrid stadium and museums. I was there for three nights but had a wonderful time and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Must say this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Was staying the standard room but it was extremely spacious! Food is a bit on the pricey side but the bar area etc. is excellent Food is excellent though, so you will get what you pay for! Had time to walk around, although a little way out its good to have a walk, especially when its still quite warm in the evenings. Breakfast was excellent, great choice, only stayed here one night but would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Tomas F
Reviews.Content: Yet again we decided to stay at the Intercontinental in Madrid. From the entrance your feel this Castilian grandeur of the lobby, after crossing the smiling doorman, a tradition in this hotel. Great Service and warm welcome. Superb, friendly staff. Summertime is a less busy moment in Madrid and the inner Garden area is just heaven during this time of year (42°C). Breakfast here is a must do as well! International and local delicatessen, a true delight. The room was great, bathroom was a dance floor and amenities fab.!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,location-best trip i've had for years”
Reviews.Author: garfieldhackett
Reviews.Content: went on inpromptu trip to madrid for a few days on august 24th and it was one of the best trips i have ever been on...my first visit to madrid and the city is amazing - but what made it perfect was the hotel we stayed at - the intercontinental - which was amazing in every way. From the moment turned up the staff were attentive without being overbearing. The room was perfect in every way - good size, comfy bed, all the facilities you would ever need and the most beautiful balcony i have ever had in a hotel. I have travelled extensively for work and pleasure and have never spent so long in any hotel room in my life - it was because the experience was faultless, perfect and the room / balcony was superb. We spent most of the trip sunbathing in our room (on balcony) during the day then taking a short metro trip in the evening into sol (about 15 mins journey / metro stn only 3 mins walk from hotel) to walk around this magnificent city....we did once go swimming in campo park but most of the the time we just strolled around the city in the evening..best way to explore madrid - i am already looking at spare dates in my diary so i can go back to madrid / intercontinental - will definitely be back within the next 2 months and there will only ever be one hotel i will ever stay in madrid now - if the rest of the intercontinentals are as good as this one in madrid i will only be staying at intercontinentals when i travel anywhere else.....perfect and cannot compliment the experience enough - want to thank all the staff for making our short break out of this world

Reviews.Title: “Splendid weeken stay.”
Reviews.Author: SmooveG
Reviews.Content: Not my first visit to Madrid but first timer in the InterContinental Madrid. I stayed there the weekend from 24th to 26th of august. Upon arrival in the hotel I was immediately escorted by the very helpful staff to the club lounge for the check-in which went flawless. After receiving all helpful information relating to the hotel I was assigned room the clubroom 654 and yes, it had a balcony :). The location of the hotel.. ok, it wasn't quite right next to Grand Via or Sol but if you familiarize yourself with the Madrid subway system, it's no biggy because the hotel lies only about 2 minutes walk from the subway station Gregorio Marañón taking you in about 10 minutes to the places that matter. Madrid airport was less than 30 minutes. I rather preferred the more quiet location. The room was spacious enough, furniture in great condition and cleanliness was spotless. Breakfast was included and there was plenty to choose from, everything looked well prepared. All personnel I encountered during my stay were very pleasant. Special thanks goes out to the club room attendants, you were simply great. During my entire stay I didn't find anything I could be complaining about. Keep up the the good work InterContinental Madrid. I will be back ones I happen to be in the area. Thank you all for everything.

Reviews.Title: “location ??”
Reviews.Author: rene c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visted Madrid for the first time in July, and wanted a affordable, clean hotel that was centrally located. The hotel itself was affordable, clean but at least a brisk 45min walk from the attractions e.g Grand Vie, The Prado Museum and The vibey city nightlife that Madrid offers, so the location was not as convientent as I hoped. However the hotel breakfast has a excellent variety( accept when u ordered a fried egg you have to be very patient as it could take at least 15min) The hotel bar (lounge) area service was very good although the English was not great they had a could do attitude. However I found the conciege not very helpful which was a shame, and did not promote things to do in there beautiful city during our four day stay. Oops and no pool, was a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: Mandy014
Reviews.Content: We wanted a luxury hotel in a quiet but central location and that is exactly what we got. The hotel meets the usual Intercontinental high standards. We were given a room with a balcony, which was a nice touch. Staff very helpful and the hotel is spotless. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “High quality”
Reviews.Author: ALEXANDRE R
Reviews.Content: Service overall is of high standard. Room service is fast with high quality food. Staff at concierge and reception is very friendly and efficient, and so is the phone operator (instant service) who seems to know everything and answered instantly on all questions that I asked. The breakfast buffet was good, without excesses in variety, but good enough though, and the service is outstanding. My room was comfortable, the curtains really close during day time allowing you a dark sleep, the bathroom is good and well equiped, the bedroom is very cleand and comfortable, the only problem being the outside traffic noise during the night, so you should request a quiet room. The gym is also high quality and free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: saritTlv
Reviews.Content: Don’t hesitate this is the best hotel in Madrid. Excellent team at the front desk, the concierge is one of a kind. Eating breakfast at the patio was amazing although it was August! The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Metro station is near by. We came a group of six including two teenagers and we had a wonderful vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: kneez
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent staff that are usually but not always friendly. The reception staff are excellent, the hotel lobby and rooms are very clean, however i had to change my room three times because they were depressing, and finally i was given a balcony room which was nice except for the lack of adequate AC in august,,ouch. The one restaurant they have serves nice buffet breakfast and a nice dinner experience. The club floor even though is nicely furnished, is almost a scam because the happy hour is non existent, and all they serve are apples a sandwich of some type and chips and a lollipop. I would recommend this hotel if you expect a 4 star service because this hotel is surely not 5 star. For my taste the location was excellent but next time i will opt for a nicer hotel, oh and by the way the room has coffee and teas in the room. but guess what they don't provide complimentary water, and it costs almost 30 euros to watch anything decent on your TV,,, start looking for something more reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Avon M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary in Madrid. The hotel was fabulous! My husband is a gold member, so we received a double upgrade and enjoyed a wonderful suite. The staff was always helpful and went out of their way to make our stay unforgettable! We wished we had stayed longer in Madrid! We'd most certainly stay here again and will highly recommend this hotel! Taxi service from the hotel was excellent and quite reasonable to all the beautiful sights that Madrid has to offer. Thank you for making this anniversary quite memorable for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel a bit away from the tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Parseltongue
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant though not perfect stay at the hotel. On arrival we were quickly checked-in and as a platinum Prioirty Club member I received a room upgrade which was greatly appreciated. We were given a room with a balcony, which was quiet as it faced the inner courtyard and enabled us to sit out in the evening as well as provide an additional source of breeze during the warm nights. The room was of a decent although not large size, with good facilities and clean. We never got the hang of the lighting system as we could have both bedside lights on, or both off, not one on and one off. The shower "curtain" (a piece of glass) had a design flaw which meant that the floor always got wet - a very basic error. Service was generally excellent throughout the hotel. The only let down was when I asked for the shaver point to be fixed on day 1, it still had not been by day 5 when we left. I have marked the hotel down by one star for continuing to charge for wifi which these days is a basic utility service. This is sheer greed and profiteering, rather like charging for electricty when it was first introduced. Additionally you had to be careful with the TV controls as there is a charge menu option for TV before you get to the free to air TV stations which were more than adequate. The hotel is a good mile from the tourist areas, and we were happy to walk to them. Some people will find they prefer to take a taxi, which are both plentiful and relatively cheap (compared to London) (and bluntly if you can afford to stay at the hotel you can afford a taxi). Overall a good hotel living up to the Intercontinental brand, and while more a business hotel it is perfectly acceptable as a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Afairley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in Madrid, as it was an easy connection from the airport and near a Metro stop. We also got a good deal from lastminute.com secret rooms. The hotel probably is more popular with business travellers - but it is still a great hotel. The staff were friendly and quick to check us in. We stayed in room 440 which was quiet and had a large balcony overlooking a courtyard. Some of the furniature in the room was showing its age, but on the whole it was clean and comfortable. As we only stayed one night we didn't see much of the hotel - but we certainly enjoyed our brief stay

Reviews.Title: “Get a room with a balcony!”
Reviews.Author: rispolo
Reviews.Content: It was a while ago since I was in Madrid and in those days we stayed at the Crowne Plaza on Plaza Espana (now closed, and I don't know what's happening with that gorgeous building)... so I was somewhat more excited than was called for to stay on the Castellana. Not at all disappointed, quite the contrary. The neighbourhood is sublime, a spit away from Serrano, and given that the Paseo is so evidently located it is idiot-proof to navigate your way from there to anywhere in Madrid. And wherever you want to go, it will be a lovely walk. Got a room with a balcony, which is a must in Madrid so it's worth the extra cost to have that luxury... the view over the Paseo is breathtaking and it's such a great feature to have during any stay. Another little luxury we enjoyed is what the InterContinental calls Club Lounge, where you have breakfast and there was also drinks/nibbles in the evening before you go out. Extremely friendly staff, very helpful when we needed assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KelleyMBA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay at the IC Madrid. The hotel very much caters to business travelers and is in the business district, so as a result the service is amazing. Everyone is friendly and says hi. The Concierge is very knowledgable and willing to help. We had a 7th floor room with a terrace overlooking the main road, which was fantastic. The hotel is well maintained and the lobby is gorgeous. There is also a very nice courtyard out back that is great for dinner and breakfast. Top notch. The location is great too. While you are further north from the downtown sites, there is a subway stop only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The surrounding neighborhood has nice restaurants and bars, as well. The hotel is about a 30 euro taxi ride from the airport, or you can also take the subway. The only downsides I can think of is that wireless is not free and drinks at the bar are very expensive. Since they most cater to business travelers I guess I shouldn't be surprised. If you are coming to Madrid for business or pleasure, I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice in Everything”
Reviews.Author: Gina064
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice room on the 5th floor at this IHG hotel, but the very special where the staff and excellent Concierge and Front office Manager who did there best for our trip. The area was good with all the public transportation very near, but also around 30 minute nice walk to downtown. At my future visit in Madrid it is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, couple of niggles”
Reviews.Author: boobmhor
Reviews.Content: This is a very grand IC property, public areas are classy and well kept. F&B offering good, staff helpful, location good with good transport links. Housekeepers are very thorough. However we had to put up with twin beds throughout our stay, despite being told we could move to a king bed on the second night (we had booked a king bed). Also the view from our window was truly horrendous, of some fans/ducts/emergency exits. I would have thought a hotel of this caliber would not have any rooms with a view this bad! All in all though a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a very pleasant experience. The hotel was very nice. The staff were very helpful. The room was very nice but very small with a double bed. We stayed in a STD room but would upgrade to a club room or higher next time. The hotel is in the financial district. 30 min.walk to downtown city center. Metro and bus very close to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet”
Reviews.Author: JamesXXI
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and the air conditioning system is the quietest I have ever encountered. In may hotels with air conditioning the choice is either to switch it off at night and bake or to leave it on and try to sleep with the unbelievable racket they make. Here, bliss, you can leave it on and not even notice the noise. Apart from that, the rooms are large and well appointed, bathrooms too, good food and a rank of taxis outside the door. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious International Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SAT33
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during my last vacation and have to say it was a real pleasure. The hotel is not directly in the city centre but not far from it and 5 minutes from a metro station.The room had a acceptable size was veyr comfortable and equipped with everything you need. The club lounge feels very exclusive and had snacks and drinks the whole day. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was absolutely great, huge selection of cold cuts, smoked fish, fresh salads and fruits....just great. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: lrblrb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental Madrid for three nights last month and it was really the most wonderful stay! The hotel was beautiful, our room was fantastic, and the location is great to hop on the train or in a taxi and head downtown. What really stood out, however, was the staff the at the hotel who were incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. The concierges helped us to arrange beautiful day trips, restaurants, and evening entertainment in the city. In particular, the Guest Relations Managers were so fantastic, kind, helpful, and accommodating. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most perfect hotels I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Katarina D
Reviews.Content: I was running a conference in this hotel. I had a feeling from the very beginning that this place was a good choice. The written communicaiton and arrangements with the Sales team was smooth, fast, professional. The conference was held during 1 week. They provided much more on top than I expected. Offered as complimentary AV, stationary, later check-out, internet, printings The hotel bedrooms - very nice, modern, clean The syndicate rooms & main meeting room - with daylight, even with a small terrace available for coffee breaks, large The staff from housekeepers, through hotel reception, concierge, sales team, instant service and coordinator was fabulous. Amazingly friendly, smiley, happy, organised, fully prepared to help me out with any request, very flexible. Thank you very much everyone from IC Madrid, we all had very good time and you made such a difference to many people.

Reviews.Title: “re: Lovely Stay and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ArmySpousechicagoil
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from Feb 17th to Feb 20th. The hotel was beautiful the service was even better. The Concierge was absolutely wonderful. I can't recall his name but he is on the tour of Madrid on the InterContinental's introduction to the city! (Maybe Juan Carlos). It was easy to get there from the airport by train, easy to get around by bus. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing staff, beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: sav_c
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my wife's 40th birthday. Before flying out I asked the hotel if they offered any celebration packages for such occasions. I was assuming there would be some upgrade offer for a set amount of some such. The hotel simply replied that they would see what they would do. When we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by their very friendly concierge and check in desk staff. The lady on reception wished my wife a happy birthday when she read the notes, which was very nice. The lady said they had allocated us a nice room. We went up to our room and it was indeed very nice. The room was clean, modern and placed at the front of the hotel overlooking the main street. The best thing was the bottle of Cava, on ice, the hotel had given us for my wife's birthday. This was a very nice and classy touch that the hotel did not have to provide but was most appreciated. As we were there for leisure, we did not use many of the hotel services and since breakfast was not included we did not use the restaurant. However we did visit the bar and that was every bit as great as the rest of the hotel. The environment is luxurious, the staff are wonderful and whoever you ask for help arrives with a smile and is genuinely happy to assist. My only minor gripe is the cost of the wifi. As a leisure traveller, all I wanted to do was check in online, but the minimum charge for internet access is 5 Euro so I didn't bother. The hotel is less than 100m away from the Gregorio Maranin metro station (although not visible directly - it's directly behind Caixa Bank), so getting around is really easy. 2 stops up is the Real Madrid stadium and only a few stops down are all the major tourist sites. Madrid is a beautiful city, the people are friendly and the sites are amazing. I would highly recommend the hotel and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and location for price! Courtyard was so-so.”
Reviews.Author: LehrFamily
Reviews.Content: The Nut Shell: The initial reaction is impressive. Great entrance which is inviting and polished. It gives you that immediate 5 star feel. The rooms are well appointed and clean. Good beds, bathroom, and Internet (free to priority club members). Location: Good location near shopping and great dinning. Short taxi to most of the historical sites. Metro is €1.5 per person and very easy to use or €10 taxi to costs del sol. Value: Deluxe rooms starting at €165. We got a deal through trip advisor's Multi search option. Rumbo had it for €122 or €144 with breakfast. For that price the room is AMAZING. Even the €160 is reasonable. The rooms are worth at least that. The Negative: The courtyard feels a little plain. It's not so bad if you don't look up. Looking up reveals an ultra plain box reaching up to the sky. Similar "view" from the balcony. Don't get me wrong. I appreciate the Balcony room but the walls look like they are from a jail house. Needs some vines or color to give it that "this is the spot" feel. This is the first all 5's I've given to a hotel pimarily based on the value boosting all the "really goods" to "great." Would go back and reccomend to family.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER FINE INTERCONTINENTAL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AUSSIETRAVELADVISER
Reviews.Content: Great service, comfortable room, club lounge provides all the usual amenities including good breakfast service. A little far out of the city centre but cabs are readily available and not expensive. Getting near time for a refurbishment but definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Madrid on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: vacationer71
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, spacious and well-appointed room. Speedy, consistent WiFi, good room service options. Did not use fitness center or pool. Nice breakfast and cocktail service in lobby restaurant. Good service at desk. Quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Probably one of the very best”
Reviews.Author: stsalkit
Reviews.Content: This is one of the very best hotels I have stayed in. Although its location is slightly off centre (not much), the fact that is virtually next to a tube station makes it all easy to go around. Everything about this hotel is at a high standard: rooms, public areas, facilities. Staff is very friendly, welcoming and accommodating. I would not stay anywhere else when in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “A perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Alistair K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in November whilst over to see Elbow. Didn't arrive till midnight, but could still check in, and grab a botlle of wine in the bar with some lovely snacks to nibble on. Hotel room on the small side but perfectly ample for our needs. Club lounge was excellent. Really spacious with lots on offer - managed a few drinks and got talking to some lovely people - at times I find club lounges quite stuffy, but not the case this time. Metro station within walking distance, that opens up the whole city. However, it's a lovely walk down to Cibeles if it's a nice day. When I was there, there was some sort of American Navy function on, so security was high, but at no time did this impair what I wanted to do in the hotel. I have been to other hotels in madrid, but will definitely return here for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great staff !”
Reviews.Author: SunnyTheAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with ease of access to great restaurants, bars, shopping, museums etc. Great staff.. thanks to Rita, Laura and Juan ! Great service !

Reviews.Title: “You have to be joking”
Reviews.Author: D j R
Reviews.Content: Any hotel that thinks it is ok to put a guest in a room with a totally opaque window needs to think again. The opaque window blocked out a lot of the light - and of course, all of the view. Except there was no view. I opened the window to find that it overlooked a dirty roof and a lot of industrial scale ventilation pipes. The single bed was narrow and uncomfortable. The public areas are full of heavy, dated, unattractive furniture. This is not one of the great hotels of Madrid, let alone the world. If you choose to stay here, make sure they do not put you in a room like mine. My visit coincided with that of a "VIP". There were guards in the elevator area on my floor, people milled around at all hours, and there was a lot of inconsiderate noise.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Gibberellin
Reviews.Content: As would be expected o a major hotel everything was superbly done. We had an excellent room on the top floor (I suspect requested by my local business office that made the reservation) with a delightful patio, though because it was January we did not make use of it. The ground floor had a huge lounge, surrounding an inner garden courtyard, with the biggest orchid display of any hotel entrance, and a piano player in the late afternoon. The breakfast was just amazing (including champagne if you wanted it!). The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Thoroughly recommended (and the cost was lower than might be expected (possibly an off season business rate).

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from the hustle and bustle.”
Reviews.Author: EarnyinLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and enjoyed that it was in a quiet area of Madrid. It is very close to public transportation and also only one subway stop away from the line that connects to the airport. Sol is not too far away but you do have to transfer to a different line and usually takes 15 minutes to get there. There is also a stop for the Madrid City tour bus where you can get on and off at various points in the city. As for the room, it is clean and very well kept. The size of the room was also just right. It's not small like most hotels in Europe but was like hotels in the US. There is a fitness room on the second floor of the hotel which is at the end of a hallway. The fitness center is small but good for a quick work out. One drawback of the area is that there isn't much open late night. Overall I would definately stay here again when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute quality !”
Reviews.Author: tjtorresdotcom
Reviews.Content: Having recently booked a trip to Madrid I was amazed to find that the 5* top secret hotel I booked on Last Minute.com was the Intercontinental. Having read previous reviews from seasoned travellers I followed the voice of experience & opted for the `club` upgrade on arrival which entitled us to a free room upgrade, free use of the club lounge & breakfast included, all for 85 euros per night for the two of us. As the breakfast was 34 euros each to start, this seemed like a good idea, especially when we opened the door to our sumptious suite, then tucked in to lashings of free quality cava in the lounge ! Overall the hotel oozed quality from the fixtures & fittings to the welcoming & professional staff which made our weekend trip perfect, just don`t expect to get in late from a night out as the lounge closes between 1030 & 11pm. When first looking for a hotel to stay we were looking at somewhere a bit closer to the centre ie. Gran Via, but having been I would say that The Intercontinental is ideally situated, close enough to all the main attractions but not too close to be mobbed, especially if you intend to tour the city on the open-topped bus which we thought was excellent. Definitely 5/5 in our view and would recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Abahmed
Reviews.Content: One of great hotels in madrid , very helpfull staff , very good location After 23:00 you can't be served , so you need to have some snaks

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: virejser
Reviews.Content: Top notch service by English speaking staff. I was upgraded to a top floor room with a terrace and beautiful view of the city. The stay was everything one would expect from an Intercontinental in a major metropolitan city. The room rate was very reasonable, the food in the restaurant was excellent, but expensive. However the hotel is in a central location close to 1,000's of great tappas bars, restaurants, etc. after all.....it is Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but under my expectations from Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: meetjoeblack
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in one of the Club rooms during a convention. Its easy to reach from airport. The lobby is nice but I guess nothing have changed since the establishment. We checked in at the Club floor. The Club rooms are really large and comfortable. The wifi works without any problems. The desk can be more comfartable for long days stay. The convention: I cant recommed the convention and meeting rooms at all. The huge columns in the middle of the rooms distract the view. The seats are covered by ugly yellow covers and kills your back and hips after half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel in Madrid with great business lounge and staff”
Reviews.Author: Doug W
Reviews.Content: I travel to Madrid quite frequently for business and used to stay at another hotel toward the north end of the Castellana. Starting last year, I switched to the intercontinental and wished I had done so years ago! The hotel is conveniently located for business purposes and is easy to get to. The staff is consistently freindly and courteous which is a nice welcome after a long flight or a long day. Rooms are all unique and well appointed. The executive lounge is fantastic and is one of the main benefits of this hotel. The breakfast in the lounge is convenient and very good, and the attached conference room provides a private and comfortable space for meeting with visiting business contacts. All in all this is a fantastic hotel and i will continue to stay here when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend and Stay”
Reviews.Author: Viajeros305
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend a weekend in Madrid before heading out to Andalucia, Spain. After a long flight the Intercontental was a welcoming oasis. From the moment we arrived we were greated at the door by the curteous doorman and staff. After a quick check-in in the Club Room we were taken to our lovely room that was fully stocked with every amenity possible from toiletries to wonderful bathrobes and slippers. After a long trip or a day of touring the city the comfortable bed with wonderful pillows that included a turndown service at night were just what we needed. Wireless internet service in our room as well as computers, printers, etc. in the clubroom came in handing when we needed to get in touch with family in the States. The lobby and common areas are tastefully decorated. Beautiful center pieces everywhere. The hotel is located close enough to shopping and points of interest by cab or metro, but far away enough from the crowds and noise. Located in an area with tree lined streets close to restaurants and shops and park benches to sit and people watch, my husband and I enjoyed a wonderful evening out for dinner without having to take a cab. The breakfast buffet was delicious as well as having a choice of a delicious made-to-order breakfast. Delicious teas, wines, beverages, cheeses, snacks and desserts greated us every afternoon after a long day. Including the Clubroom in our stay was worth it for us. We would like to thank Susana Gari, Guest Relations Manager, Clubroom and other hotel staff for their undivided attention and for making us feel like we were the only guest in the hotel. We had a wonderful and pleasant experience at the Intercontinental, Madrid. When visiting Madrid, this is where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, amazing club lounge”
Reviews.Author: ajnoone
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a leisure weekend, had a beautiful suite on the 7th floor, with a great terrace. The weather wasnt great, so a perfect reason to use the hotels facilities. The club lounge offering was perfect, with an amazing breakfast buffet, and a complimentary cava and rioja bar all day. I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Alshamsan
Reviews.Content: Perfect staff, conceirge is excellent, price is good. Location is calm and near good shoping area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Great City”
Reviews.Author: Runnercon71
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place to spend a long weekend. Madrid, the city of trees, boasts some beautiful architecture and restaurants in a city bursting with culture, tapas bars and shops. Myself and my wife stayed here during my endeavours to run the Madrid Rock n Roll Marathon. The hotel staff were very accommodating although the bar prices were quite off putting. €18 for a Coke and a glass of wine was a bit steep even for a 5 star hotel. In summary we had a faultless stay really and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Starting Point for Your Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Convinced
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Madrid Intercontinental for a week while on business travel. In terms of expectations, the Madrid Intercontinental is older, but well-maintained, and it fits better in the category of upscale business hotel rather than a five-star experience. Location / Service The hotel was close to shops in Serrano and a scenic 20 minute walk or short Metro/taxi ride away the city center and major sights. It was nicer than a standard business hotel and a good starting point for business travelers and tourists as long as being a little further from the center of town is not an issue. The front desk and concierge staff were helpful in making local recommendations and reservations, but were not particularly friendly. Room The room was on the smaller side, but cleaner and nicer than the average business hotel and the bed was very comfortable. Since my room faced the air shaft, there was not much natural light, but I didn't mind since I was out during day. The lobby had a quiet and spacious lounge/bar area for meetings. Dining The breakfast buffet had excellent options and variety. In particular, the selection of meats, cheeses and other local specialties were a nice touch. I would consider staying here again the next time I am in town for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed in Chamberi”
Reviews.Author: rachelannmorris
Reviews.Content: i had always promised myself I would return to Madrid after an all to brief stay in 2007. While not in the heat of the touristy action, the Intercontinental is perfectly located for those who like a bit of luxury in a quieter part of town. A short taxi ride or metro hop to the famous Museum Mile or Plaza Mayor, it's also a 10-15 minute walk to Calle Serrano which ahs several good restaurants and all the high end boutiques you could need. The hotel is plush in an old school way, complimented by the charming and always knowledgeable staff. Travelling as a solo woman for this trip, from the moment I was collected at the airport through to check in at the Intercontinental's Club lounge and beyond, I was made to feel special. The hotel I suspect is one of the busiest in Madrid and during my stay hosted an international conference of government ministers, a wedding and a communion as well as other events over my four night stay, so there was always something happening in the lobby and around. The rooms are large by European standards with big comfortable beds, a pillow menu, tea and coffee facilities and some like mine have a small balcony with chairs and a table. The bathroom is equally spacious with a proper bathtub and elemis amenities. A word about the bed and pillow - one word, sublime. I slept so well I almost missed an appointment one morning and as a habitual light sleeper, that's an achievement. The Club lounge is seriously great. The compact breakfast buffet includes the usual cheeses and cold cuts, juice and coffee as well as hot items which change daily, but a supplemental menu allows you to order eggs any way (try the spanish omelette), bacon and grilled tomatoes and the assortment of pastries, muffins and donuts tested my diet resolve daily. Snacks are available throughout the day as well as a selection of wine and afternoon tea sees cakes and other morsels brought out. The traditional evening drinks (wine, sherry, cava) come later than most (it is Madrid after all) with a selection of tapas and other items. The Club team from the desk staff through to the waiters were very helpful. Back to the services, I tried the spa, which I was told was in a temporary location until a new one is built. The young Argentinian therapist was knowledgeable and well trained and soothed some of my tourist-related foot problems. The gym attached to the spa is small but functional and for business travellers, open 24 hours. I only had a chance to sample the bar on the ground level of the hotel which was excellent and quite lively at times. Being Madrid, I took the advice of the staff and headed out and about for sustenence. The concierge team recommended two excellent restaurants serving regional cuisine as well as several great boutiques and stores to satisfy my shopping urges. They even helped with booking tickets to museums and other advice. They along with the hotel's GM Manrique Rodriguez and the rest of the team basically helped me plan my entire time in Madrid and made my stay truly memorable. I'll be back for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay may 2012”
Reviews.Author: avnipriya
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel Good location 20 mins from the airport on underground Breakfast lovely Safe location of the hotel Concierge very helpful Reception can be very busy Wifi very expensive Rooms facing the garden quiet Clean rooms Clean facilities Rooms small but fine for a couple Tube stop 4 minutes away Bus stop nearby Overall pleasant hotel Nice hotel Would recommend it Gym functional

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asusd1
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Madrid has a great location and it is in the middle of everything. It is easy to stroll to many attractions, great food and the upscale shopping area of Madrid. The Metro is close by and easy to navigate to go to other parts of the city. The staff is exceptionally friendly and provide the best clue that this hotel is rated a 5 star. The rooms were only adequate and did not live up to other 5 star hotels in Europe and probably is the lowest level of luxury of any Intercontinental Hotel we have stayed in to date. The view from the rooms is a dirty courtyard and other buildings. The location is just not one that will lend to an excellent view. One plus, there is a little mall a couple of blocks away with nice stores and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: blackmartini
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are well kept, clean and comfortable. Location is pretty good considering its in the business district, 15min walk to the shopping streets. The rooms are not that big though but good size already for a hotel in madrid. I must say, it was a good stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms for a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bellicious
Reviews.Content: We expected a better standard of room due to the 5* rating but it was tiny, however it was comfortable. This hotel is not very central but it is close to a bus stop for the open top bus tour which will take you to all the attractions of Madrid. Average hotel, nothing special at an above average price!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edward77021
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, a little further out of the city centre than i would have liked but nice hotel itself. staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: psti
Reviews.Content: For my family of 4 I booked two rooms (Spanish law requires it) in the Club level. I was pleasantly surprised that we were upgraded to two connecting rooms with one them a suite. We had quite a bit of space, use of the club lounge and breakfast included. We used the lounge quite a bit after each day of sight seeing. I enjoyed the variety of breakfast foods available. The hotel staff responsible for cleaning the rooms were fantastic. Little things like picking up dirty clothes and placing them a laundry bag is one example I wasn't expecting but was pleasantly surprised by. I do have a few reservations about the hotel; there is a scarcity of restaurants near the hotel and the hotel staff do not seem to know much about them, which transitions into my next comment about the staff. Comments are well intended but were often off the mark for instance travel distances around town, what terminals airlines reside in and hours of operation of local restaurants. Suggest double checking with another source prior to acting on anything. Overall, I was pleased to stay at the hotel. My entire family enjoyed their stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff really went that extra bit further”
Reviews.Author: Smorgasbord_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2012 for a weekend break to Madrid. We had a disastrous journey resulting in Easyjet losing my baggage and when we mentioned that to the reception staff they immediately offered to liaise with the airport to get the bags delivered to the hotel once they had arrived in Madrid and even upgraded our room and gave us an emergency overnight kit with toothbrush, shaving kit etc. I think it helped that my husband is a loyalty card holder but even so, it was a nice touch. The hotel is really nice, even by intercontinental standards with a glamourous marble lobby and pianist playing in the evenings. We stayed in a room on the road side of the building but were quite high up so hardly heard any traffic. The junior suite we had was nice and had a really great selection of toiletries - very important when your washbag is lost somewhere between Toulouse and Madrid! Only slight grumble was the cleaning staff forgot to give us towels one day, but one call to reception and they delivered us new ones in a matter of minutes. The location of the hotel is not in the absolute centre of town, but I preferred it being slightly quieter. You can hop on the metro which is fewer than 100m walk away and be where you want to be in seconds. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, as we thought it was overpriced, but enjoyed sitting outside a little cafe in the city centre in the sun with a glass of fresh orange juice and some Seranno ham and eggs - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Good traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: This is a good traditional quality hotel with elegant decor and big rooms. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom commodious, and the service very pleasant, and I liked the spanish cheeses and ham with breakfast. Overall I enjoyed the stay. I have some minor reservations however:- - the reception desk area is small and could easilt lead to delays - there was not enough hot water in my room for a comfortable shower either in the morning or the evening - the room had no view but looked out into a small triangular area

Reviews.Title: “Week before Easter in Madrid - Intercontinental Club room”
Reviews.Author: mhbarker
Reviews.Content: This was a late winter holiday, traveling down from Finland seeking a bit of warmth... The hotel building, fixtures and fittings are about average for an Intercontinental, maybe a bit better than New York, not quite as good as the ICs in Vienna, Malta or Beijing. We had a non-smoking Club room (854) on the top floor facing into the courtyard... nice and quiet for sleeping, but a very dull view. Couldn't make use of the room's balcony as it rained most of the week. King size double bed was very comfy, pillows were a bit soft. Toiletries decent, water was pressure pretty poor and during one shower the water cut out for 30 seconds. WiFi in the Club rooms is complimentary, but not very fast. Fast enough for e-mail and checking the news. Not very many power sockets in the room, with 2 phones, PC, tablet and camera to charge we could have done with more sockets on the desk as we had to use one behind a chair and the shaver outlet in the bathroom too... What makes this hotel worth a stay is the Club Lounge. We booked a Club room, on arrival we were escorted to the Club lounge for check-in and had some drinks and snacks whilst our room keys were prepared. The lounge has either food or drinks and nibbles available from opening at 07:00 practically until half an hour before they close at 23:00. Breakfast in the Club lounge is excellent, staff are attentive & helpful, they will order down to the main restaurant for omelettes / tortilla on request. We stayed 7 nights and had breakfast in the lounge on 5 of mornings. The other 2 mornings, we went to the main restaurant for a buffet breakfast, slightly wider choice and also pretty good. We had dinner just once in the hotel restaurant towards the end of the stay, the paellas were excellent, as was the service, but €40 for two green salad starters is a bit steep. Rooms service food is a bit hit and miss - on the final evening we ordered whilst packing, my wife enjoyed the lamb tagine / cuscus dish, but my pizza appeared to be straight out of the freezer (I'd deliberately asked when ordering if they made the pizza fresh - I was assured it was :-/ ) ... €22 for a Dr Oetker style pizza is a bit steep. A room service coke was €9!!! Not that I bought one. The concierge guys were also very helpful, we got tour bus tickets and stamps from there, loaned umbrellas, had advice on which Metro and bus routes to use to the various attractions. The hotel is in a business area of Madrid, so not there's not much in the way of shops, restaurants or cafes nearby, just bank and insurance company offices. There's more to see on the Calle de Serrano which runs parallel to Paseo de la Castellana one block East. In summary, a good hotel if you take a Club room, excellent staff, but their restaurant / room service is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: E18MMA
Reviews.Content: Booked the Intercontinental via Expedia on a last minute Easter break to Madrid. I wrote to them asking if they could make sure our time there was memorable and they did not disappoint! We were relatively budget travelers, but had an amazing room, almost a suite, with a complementary bottle of Cava on ice as we arrived in our room! The bed was bigger than my house! We asked the concierge if he could get us last minute tickets to see the Real Madrid v Valencia match, and he did everything he could and managed to get us some ;-) No hidden charges, very good service. Yes a little out of town, but very close to the Metro, straight into the centre of Madrid, plus Metro almost right on the line to airport for our return Thank you very much to all at the Intercontinental, our romantic weekend in Madrid was nothing short of amazing, thanks to you

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start, but overall fine”
Reviews.Author: GreatWhiteCloud
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly modern. A little tired in places, but overall to a soldly high standard. Upon arriving late, we were given a twin room rather than a single bed. Then moved to a room with a very very loud aircon rattle. Room 3 was a smoking room. Just before going back to the aircon rattle room (with the advise to turn it off and open the door) they discovered that a fourth room was available. It turned out to be tiny - clearly a single person's room. We moved back to the squeeky room the next day after the aircon was repaired. Over the course of the 4 nights we also had room service walk in unannounced twice. At 4pm and 8am - very strange. The bar was lovely and huge, but horribly horribly overpriced for a city with fabulous, plentiful and cheap quality drinks. The room we ended up with was large, clean, plush, with a lovely bathroom. TV was fine - while we had 10 English news chanels there was no movie channel. Overall staff were friendly and helpful. Especially concierge and the door staff. A tip though, get them to empty out the fridge and stock it yourself. It's automated, so if you pick up that power adapter - boom EUR10 goes instantly on your account. Location is handy to Serrano for shopping, and Chueca which is a great area. It's also on the metro line to Sol and Opera for Old Madrid. And just a 20 min walk down the lovely Castellana to the museum district.

Reviews.Title: “I will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: TheMoet
Reviews.Content: Now one of my favourites, clean, classy, modern, convenient, and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “rather intermediate”
Reviews.Author: ButNekkid
Reviews.Content: Not bad, but not necessary good, rather intermediate. Hotel and rooms are nice, a bit out-of-date, but still nice. Personnel is very polite and mostly helpful. Bar was magnificent:) Hotel needs some renovation and the location is not very convenient if you came to Madrid as a tourist, in general it was fine, but I've seen better, good 4 stars instead of 5. PS. No English channels on the TV, all in Spanish, keeping in mind, that there are plenty of international guests, I think it should be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful concierge and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kimty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2010. The hotel's location is very convenient, especially if you are someone who likes to shop -- the hotel is a short walk from the best shopping area in Madrid and also close to some fabulous dining and bars options. While the concierge was extremely helpful, I would say that the appearace of the hotel and the room were not really a 5-star. The room, while comfortable, looked a bit outdated and needed a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: mobyrock
Reviews.Content: First class hotel in fabulous location, near the metro...rooms very well decorated and furnishings Eastern - inspired, overlooking the courtyard. Nothing was too much trouble and even though I arrived late, there was a friendly greeting and help taking materials to the room we had booked for the next day where everything was set-up and ready. Whilst this was a business trip - would certainly stay for pleasure next time. The employees were helpful, knowledgeable and the food superb. All went to plan and we had a superb experience from start-to-finish. A role-model for other hotels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: CXM
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just came back from a short week/long weekend trip to Madrid and Avila. We stayed at the hotel InterContinental in Madrid at Paseo de la Castellana. This is not our first stay there as we frequent Madrid on a regular basis. And it will certainly not be the last time we stay either. This hotel is conveniently located a block away from the metro with easy connections to Barajas Airport. It sits a block away from bus routes 27 and 45 which makes it easy to reach the Thiessen and Prado Museum. What makes this hotel spectacular besides its beautiful and comfortable rooms, is the service. People just go out of their way to ensure that your every need is met. I highly recommend that if possible you stay at the Club level, their breakfast and happy hours are one of the best I have ever experienced. Hands down one of Europe's finest hotels. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best of it's class in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Вадим Г
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent for all the amenities, rooms, special service to Priority Club guests ( I am - with a special check-in and -out room with refreshments and snacks, internet, books and magazines etc.) A splendid bonus! The staff are very polite, helpful and tactful. Very nice selection of various foods and beverages for breakfast. Excellent bar! We wanted to watch ice hockey (in Spain in summer!) – they went out if their way to find the right satellite channel showing the match and even provide special sitting option for a large group. The rooms are very comfortable and well decorated. Indeed, a very pleasant stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “cannot wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: view-with-a-room
Reviews.Content: Wonderful three day visit to Madrid. The staff were exceptional! The doorman is by far the favorite staff as he greeted me each and every entry and exit! Immediately escorted to the club by the desk staff to check in for a club room. The club is quite nice and should be considered regardless of status with the loyalty program. The club is open late so do have a tour prior to check in. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Again the staff were exceptional with the doorman, the desk staff, the club staff, the room service staff, the mini bar staff, the mineral water staff, the ham staff, and the turn down staff. One day the room was visited by six staff members and each and every visit was a pleasant visit. The area is quite nice and convenient to the metro and the airport via the metro. I love to explore neighborhoods and found wonderful shopping and food within blocks of the hotel. Madrid and the hotel are quite reasonable so a return visit is in order in the not so distant future. I found a wonderful deli and wonderful shopping mere blocks from the hotel on the final day and cannot wait to sample more of the offerings of the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business visit”
Reviews.Author: SusansBackInScotland
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here, the staff are great and can't do enough for you. Because it's about a 30 minute walk from the centre of Madrid you do need to either enjoy walking OR catch cabs, but cabs are plentiful and reasonably priced in Madrid so this wasn't a major hassle. The upside of this meant it was nice and quite for sleeping at night which is really important on business visits. A cab into the city is about €8 The room was standard European size (not very big) but the bathroom was quite roomy. One critisism I do have is that the only English language tv they had was the interminably boring news networks. I don't speak Spanish so had to resort to watching CSI dubbed into Austrian, if I was there longer than a few days I'd say bring a multimedia player or download some movies or tv before you go. Also the internet was terribly slow. We ate in the restaraunt for dinner one night, the food was really pretty nice, and it's an attractive conservatory dining room. I also had room serivce one night, it was a bit average. The room service menu and mini bar are ferociously expensive, like a lot of business hotels €6.50 for a small mineral water, so if you are visiting on your own dollar you'd want to stock up at the supermarket. The breakfast is €32, it's a nice breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fozziedoggie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just about a week. Hotel is in the banking area of the city, so the area is dead on the weekends....not complaining, makes it very peaceful and quiet. Metro stop located just two minutes around the corner. Very professional and courteous staff. Hotel itself is not very large/imposing. Dining area is beautiful, but for me, the prices were on the high side ($7 USD for a piece of toast). However, coming here in the off-tourist season netted me a great room rate. Would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Hotel in Madrid for Me”
Reviews.Author: watrskiergurl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classy, helpful, clean, great food....just perfection. I travel a lot for business and this by far is one of the best places i've stayed. The buffet is stupendous. The hotel rooms are clean and excellent. The balcony is so peaceful. It looks out onto the courtyard. Rooms are big, bed is SO COMFY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Intercontinental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: collector
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at the Madrid Intercontinental Hotel January 26-30, 2012. When we arrived at the hotel after our early morning arrival, we were directed to the 1st floor Club to check in. Susanna Gari was wonderful, she greeted us by name and accommodated us for an early check in. I am a Royal Ambassador and so we were upgraded to a suite. It was truly luxurious. From the time we checked in until we left everything was flawless. I can certainly tell you that has not always been the case when I have stayed at some Intercontinental Hotels. We truly appreciated the professional manner of the entire staff. Pedro in the Club was great, we enjoyed visiting with him while we enjoyed our glass of champagne. Hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laug058
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Great location, walkable to most main attractions, on the main thouroughfare so easy to get to / from but also far enough away from the chaos of Sol! Room was nice and the value for money was superb. Really enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but don't order room service”
Reviews.Author: rivertrader46
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the end of a vacation trip to Spain. This is a big deluxe business hotel with very nice rooms. There are several downsides if you are in Madrid to see the sights. The hotel is a long walk from most of the major sights in Madrid. It is also not a close walking distance to any restaurants and the hotel food is very expensive. We chose room service because we were tired and a simple hamburger was USD $40. We paid over $100 for a couple of sandwichs and a cheap bottle of wine. . The food was adequate but not great. There are better ways to spend your money in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Truly InterContinental with a unique spanish flair!”
Reviews.Author: Smaaklik
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip in Madrid. Booked a club room. The room was supplied with all you could possibly need, from coffee/tea station to stationery sets. A wide range of pillows are just a room service call away to suite your sleeping habits. Staff are friendly and prompt. Most of the staff speak English. The room magically got cleaned and prepared everyday, with everything refilled that was used. The beds are excellent as well as the sheets and linen used. The hotel has a too classfitness centre with spa treatments that are really well priced. Breakfast is a real Spanish treat with anything you could possibly imagine. Be sure to give the local Jamon a try at breakfast and at the surrounding tapas bars - it is to die for! Freshly squeezed juices are always available and hot chocolate on tap. I would reccomend anyone going to Madrid to make this Hotel their home.

Reviews.Title: “Increible”
Reviews.Author: BegoAlicante_Espa_a
Reviews.Content: Es un hotel increíble, muy buen servicios, habitaciones muy amplias, con amplias prestaciones. No le falta ni un solo detalle.

Reviews.Title: “BRILL”
Reviews.Author: planepete163
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in October, dont believe the negatives , usually ungratefull people from across the pond , if your too tight to pay for breakfast its your loss , it was the best we have ever expierianced . So its not in the centre of town but the walk is great and we are pensioners , besides its great to be with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Dec. 30”
Reviews.Author: m2cc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on Dec. 30 for one night; the room was very large as most of the hotels of this chain. Wireless network was expensive. Printing boarding passes was a nightmare, as we were supposed to go through their business center and buy a 30 minutes pass at 5 Euro; we actually gave up and printed them at the airport. The hotel is a bit too far to walk to any of the major sights in Madrid, but it is very close to a metro station. Buffet breakfast was very good but the food was spread on various tables and it was not easy to get an overall view of what was available; maybe it was because they were setting up the hotel for the New Year's Eve gala dinner and party. When we checked out we had a nice surprise: we got a nice tray of Spanish sweets with the wishes to the Director of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs-up for the excellent staff, thumbs-down for the breakfast and Internet fares”
Reviews.Author: q-sto
Reviews.Content: Overall I was quite satisfied with my weekend stay. I chose this hotel as I could get a decent prepaid fare - discounted weekend price for a Deluxe double room was €119 excluding breakfast. The hotel is conveniently located near two metro stations: Gregorio Maranon or Ruben Dario. Travel time from the airport is around half an hour. Check-in was quick and I felt welcome - a HUGE thumbs-up regarding staff friendliness and efficiency during my entire stay. All staff members that I met were helpful and professional. A special thanks to the Concierge who really took a lot of time to find the information I needed. My room was comfortable and functional - with many amenities: flat-screen TV, much appreciated coffee-making facilities, individual air-conditioning, small writing desk. Very comfortable double bed with firm mattress and fluffy pillows. All equipment were working properly. Room had no view but was particularly quiet. Bathroom spotlessly clean with adequate amenities - however it is a bit small and feels slightly cramped. I ordered room service for dinner. Excellent service with reasonable waiting time of 25 minutes. Starter (Iberian ham) and main course (Paella Valenciana) were delicious. On the downside breakfast buffet was outrageously expensive (€38), so that I preferred to eat outside the hotel. Internet fares for the business corner were also quite expensive: €9 for one hour! A 5-star hotel should really offer Internet access free of charge. All in all I can warmly recommend this hotel - mostly for its great staff and central location. However I would greatly appreciate a lower breakfast price.

Reviews.Title: “InterConti quality with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: xirxy
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, not too large hotel which offers the high InterConti quality. The room was excellent, large and clean. Especially the service was very good, I think they really try to give you the best room, dining choices etc. they can offer. In other hotels (InterConti) I sometimes had the feeling that "the more you give the more you get" counts - really just profit-orientated.Here, it is not. Unfortunately, it is a bit far away from the center. The name "InterConti Madrid" may insinuate this could be a perfect location for tourists but actually this is rather a business area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice long weekend package”
Reviews.Author: wolfsbgk
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, asked for a quiet room, got one, no view though but very quiet. Room on the small side but very comfortable. Easy walk to a number of tube stations - easy to get around Madrid. Staff were very attentive, accomodating, tried their best to help us and the service was generally very good. Bar is expensive but drinks are generous and you get snacks, lovely Sushi (Miyama) restaurant about half a block up from the hotel, opens at 20.30. Check out was a pleasure, took only a few minutes and we were allowed late checkout of 13.30 (any later is charged at half-day rate) but we were allowed to leave our luggage in the hotel until our trip to the airport at 16.30 and the doorman organised this for us as well as the taxi plus advice on how much the fee would be - which was spot on. The hotel Sunday brunch is great if a little pricy but the food and service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: clare m
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very nice room, great service. The room was very comfortable and the phone call from reception to ask if we needed anything was welcolmed. Breakfast was delightful (if a little pricey). Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: shields77
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel, fantastic staff, courteous and the hotel is situated in a beautiful part of town. Bar staff were also so attentive and excellent, the rooms were beautiful, spotless clean and well kept. The one thing i would say as a negative, it is extremely expensive (room service etc). I had a great stay and will return on my next visit to madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great property for celebrating our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: SilverSpringer
Reviews.Content: I am an Intercontinental Ambassador, a status that allows a free upgrade and other benefits when staying at Intercontinental hotels. My husband and I spent three nights at the Intercontinental Madrid to celebrate our anniversary. We booked the hotel by calling the Ambassador office and the staff member suggested we book the deluxe executive room to give us a better chance for an upgrade to a club room. We also were able to use the buy one night, get one free certificate you get with Ambassador status so we paid for two nights but got three nights stay. We arrived at the hotel at 9 am--after the usual early morning arrival flight from the US. We were escorted to the club lounge to check in and the Club Lounge manager, Susana, found a room for us for an early checkin. This property is very well appointed. Getting a club room means a larger room--ours was very nice with a very large bathroom as well--and access to the club lounge which includes free breakfast at the lounge or restaurant, snacks and drinks during the day including afternoon tea and evening drinks. Use of the computers at the lounge, newpapers in lounge and free internet in the hotel were also included. We felt very pampered at this hotel so it was a great location for an anniversary celebration. The hotel is not in the central, old Madrid section but is a short walk from two metro stations. If you don't have much luggage, you can take the metro from the airport with one change of station for 2.5 Euros. If you have a lot of luggage, don't do this as there are steps to climb. The taxi fare from the airport runs from 25-30 euros depending on traffic. Recommended for a special occasion particularly if you get a club room and a free night!

Reviews.Title: “Right swanky experience”
Reviews.Author: Ezzie L
Reviews.Content: Okay, we would not have gone except we got a very good rate through last-minute.com for a mystery five-star hotel, so we were paying about £105 a night for a double room. The first night. The room was a bit small, but they very kindly upgraded us have the room could not have been better. Very pleasant staff. Drinks quite expensive in the bar but that is what one expects

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanNomads
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff are lovely, particularly the front desk and the concierge. On the night I arrived (speaking no Spanish, alas), the concierge were really helpful in finding a fabulous Chinese restaurant ..calling the restaurant to inform them I’m a vegetarian, and then wrote a note in Spanish to remind them. Was a lovely touch! The room was also very well appointed. I’m a priority club member and got an upgrade. The only negative was the cost of the internet – 55 euros for 5 days use whereas in other intercontinental hotels, I'd have been eligible to free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Club Level is worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MarinTravelDude
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Madrid has most of what you would expect from InterContinental: nice rooms, gracious service, good location, can-do staff. This property was a very easy place to stay and my family just LOVED going to the club for snacks and drinks. Always a nice selection of tasty treats, cava or coffee. Very fun.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Hornistas
Reviews.Content: The first problem was that we were bounced to another hotel on the first night because they had double booked and blamed it on a computer fault. We were transfered back for 3 nights after the night 'away' and upgraded to a better room. The lobby had a faint smell of drains which never disappeared. The room service was inconsistent. The WC developed a fault on our last morning which was not ideal! The location is good and the Metro is by far the best means of getting around. Bearing in mind that the hotel is a 5* it has to be judged by that standard and it was only average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Pardfan
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel seems to host a lot of business travelers, if you like to use public transportation it is also idea for tourists. There are convenient metro stops near the hotel. Like all Intercontinentals, this one is elegant and well staffed. Although our room was a bit tight, the spacious bathroom with separate shower and tub made up for it. And the lovely view of the courtyard was nice. The concierge got us tickets for the Prado so we didn't have to stand in line. Someone in housekeeping got us the pillows we desired and also removed the duvet from the bed and gave us just what we wanted for a cover ( Spain was experiencing a very hot October and we were roasting despite the A/C). The breakfast buffet was splendid-you can definitely fuel up for day of seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lissette0708
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected issue come about and this hotel provided superior and elite service. This is not in the center of town but it's very close to it. I don't like to stay in the city so this hotel was just perfect. The only thing I must say is that expect for the rooms to be small, like NYC small. I was upgraded since I'm a Platinum Elite member and I got a room on the 9th floor in the corner, my balcony was huge! If I ever go back to Madrid, this is the hotel I will stay at. Thank you once again for all of your help!

Reviews.Title: “Madrid hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickLV
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to intercontinental Madrid. Upon arriving late unwashed redirected to the club lounge for checkin where I was greeted and quickly setup with a room that was upgraded. The concierge was good and spoke multiple languages. The hotel restaurant was fantastic and room service was a nice option. The mini bar was well stocked. The beds were comfortable. The taxis were waiting and the hotel room service was fantastic every note left went completed and above what was expected. Used the lounge for breakfast once and it was great. Didn't use the spa or fitness tho. Good location and lots of great walking around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: JimS48
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel two or three times a year. Service is always excellent. Doormen make sure the taxi drivers do not overcharge. The Club Lounge is excellent. Comfort, convenience and nice range of drinks and food provided free of charge

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: Being in Madrid for the first time, I was cautiously optimistic about what to expect upon arrival. I travel quite a bit and I can tell you with complete assurance that I was awestruck immediately by the genuine nature of the service staff. From curbside and reception to housekeeping, concierge, and most especially the Guest Relations Manager, Susana, I encountered nothing but the most courteous, helpful and professional staff. Perfect hotel for entertaining clients. Well appointed lounge and restaurant, with plenty of room and comfortable seating, allows plenty of space for conducting business. Nearby to some great restaurant experiences and nightlife as well. I was upgraded to a stunning suite which was spacious, immaculate and truly fit for a king. The Ambassador Club membership is well worth it! Overall the single top hotel experience to date.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siddharthdhamija
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay but as usual it’s on an expensive side. Very good rooms, great room service, helpful staff and of course a good Bar

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesley L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel on a main avenue in the city. Very clean. Great rooms with well appointed furniture. Bathrooms are nice as well. Separate "room" for the toilet. Double sinks. Hair dryer in bathroom. No outlet for the curling iron in the bathroom. The housekeeping service was outstanding. Daily turn-down service with light housekeeping in the evenings as well. Very friendly staff. Concierge guys were very helpful. Be careful with mini-bar charges. It is an electronic mini-bar and automatically charges your room whenever you move something. However, the front desk had no problem removing the charges. We stayed on points. I am an Ambassador member and Platinum Priority Club. The hotel does not honor Priority Club status (so, no free internet, club access, etc.). They did however, upgrade my room to a King Garden View room with Balcony upon my request due to my Ambassador Club membership. I bought a membership with points just before the stay solely to attempt to get an upgrade. Well worth it. My reservation was for a double (which apparently is 2 twin beds). That was the only available option when booking with points. So, the king (with balcony) was very welcome! Internet charges: $15/day or $24 for 2 days. This includes 3 devices (i.e. laptop, smartphone, etc.) I would definitely stay here again (at least on points - too expensive otherwise).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: PerthAngie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and the staff were great. The location is out of the main tourist areas, but can easily be accessed via the metro or car. We had a room which was not overly spacious, but was all that we needed being out of the room a lot. From other reviews it looks like it is worthwhile asking for an upgrade. The parking at the hotel is approx 30 euros per night, and other options are street parking which on weekends is a much more economical option.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: we_travel_with_kids5
Reviews.Content: Don' be put off by other reviews stating this hotel is far from all the tourist spots. This hotel is in an exceelent location with a metro stop not even two mins. away. We had an interconecting room which was excellent, rooms are large and very comfortable. We didn't have a view but that didn't bother us. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Great to come back to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing and know you will not be bothered by beggers. The only downside is internet is very expensive and very slow, other than that, keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: Robbie S
Reviews.Content: stayed here for only one night because of this we didnt see much of the actual hotel or experience breakfast so this review is based solely on the room and location. We got a free upgrade on arrival and the rooms were huge! great bathroom, bed, a seating area and great view out into madrid. The staff were all very helpful and welcoming. The hotel is 2 minutes from a subway station and very easy to find if traveling from the airport. would stay here again if returned to madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean rooms, quick access from the airport”
Reviews.Author: Taylor1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in september 2011. Thanks to our Ambassador Program we were upgraded and had a very nice room with view of Paseo de la Castellana. The room was large and clean, bathroom was well equiped and the staff were incredibly friendly! Keep up the good work! The online downside of the trip were the pillows, which were too soft for us. But this is a personal matter and in no way diminishes our appreciation of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Intercontinental Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JeppisPibe
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just fantastic. Personel was very friendly and helpful. I booked this hotel using the reward bonuses, and they even upgrades us to a suite - fantastic room! We love this hotel for it´s location. All the nice shops of Serrano and that area are just minutes away. There are also lot´s of up-scale restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: eldojo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful, the staff was great. Nice bar, loved the olives. Ask for Pepe. So helpful, I want to go again...soon.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, but misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: astrolake
Reviews.Content: Five star hotels always have great pillows and beds, that was the best part of this hotel. However, it just somehow misses. There is no pool (essential for summer madrid heat). Many of the rooms (like ours) face walls a few feet away from the windows. The sound proofing is poor, nonexistent in the connecting doors (ours had one on both sides, but we even heard the family a few doors down sound as thought they were just outside our door.
