It also misses classic 5* services like turndown and a chocolate on the pillow. And in this day and age, 20Euros/day for internet is plain crazy beyond the pale nickel and diming.

Reviews.Title: “Cool in Hot Madrid”
Reviews.Author: langdalelad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went with my daughter and her boyfriend. She has lived in Madrid and we have been to the IC before. Flight was late in so we missed our restaurant reservation but food and wine in the bar at midnight was excellent. We had Club rooms and the club was a pleasant place to have breakfast and drinks. A bit too busy in the mornings and the canapes not quite as good as previously but still fine. Rooms were comfortable and a couple of minor maintenance issues were corrected within minutes. The Sunday buffet brunch is not cheap but was the best of its kind we have had. The hotel has a lovely light and cool atmosphere which is ideal in a Madrid summer.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it, stayed there twice in one month”
Reviews.Author: travelsmiles2011
Reviews.Content: first time i stayed there, i got a small room. but my next visit i got a bigger room. so it was up to luck which size of a room you get. they have the best hotel concierge. Iberia airline lost my bag and the concierge followed the issue with the airline untill he got my suitcase back and delivered to my room, while i was out sight seeing. Alfredo Garcia, you are the best, thank you for recommending the Argentinian restaurant, loved the steak. this hotel should have more than 5stars if they just had bigger rooms. loved my stay there and i will for sure stay again there. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Big money for a small room”
Reviews.Author: santiagowhite
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for two nights and was surprised at how small the guest rooms are. There was not even enough space to put my luggage! It was definetely too much money spent for such a tiny room. I have to say the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: OutofRange331
Reviews.Content: The InterConti in Madrid is a great, elegant hotel. There's no modern, minimalist design here. Opulence all the way from the marble-covered lobby to the rooms which have carpet-covered floors, curtains made of heavy fabric, big beds, and a bathroom bigger than my apartment. The rooms have plenty of modern amenities, including a flat-screen TV, internet connectivity and AC, which was key given 90+ F/33+ C temperature in Madrid in late July. I only stayed for 24 hours, but the service was great and the staff kind. There is a spa and a gym as well, for those who are ambitious. I had grand plans to make it to the gym, but those thoughts were quickly dashed after a late dinner with a colleague. Close to many attractions and the metro, this hotel is a nice splurge when visiting this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjrober727
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family while traveling in Madrid. It was a little away from the part of the city where all the attractions are, but it was right near a subway stop, so it wasn't bad at all. The hotel provided excellent service...they recommended a great restaurant for dinner nearby and helped us with directions to everything we wanted to visit. The hotel bar was a bit pricey, but it had good service and was a nice place to spend some time when we first arrived. Overall, I think this is a great hotel if you're looking for a clean, safe place with quality service. We had a discount where it was under $300/night. If you're going to pay more than that, it may not be worth it, because there wasn't anything REALLY special about it that would make it worth more than cheaper hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK but probably expensive for the money”
Reviews.Author: jonwells1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at ICH at the weekend prior to a business trip and would make the following observations. 1) Room upgraded to a high floor with an outside balcony as part of Ambassador membership. The room was 2 single beds though - no good for my height and I changed rooms. Membership didn't give me any club lounge access and I received nothing like water on arrival or a newspaper. 2) Breakfast is very poor. The hot buffet is easily the worst I have seen in a few years for the quality of hotel. Bacon was missing for 2 days and I had to ask for it. Most of the hot buffet looks very unappetising. Milk doesn't come with the tea and has to be asked for. Difficult to get staff attention. 3) No newspapers. Anywhere. I have never been in a 4star hotel before where newspapers weren't available to guests as standard in the breakfast area. 4) Staff at dinner were much better but its pretty expensive, A starter of truffled eggs (which turns out to be 2 fried eggs with some fried potato on the side) was about 20 euros. 5) Wifi is extremely expensive at 20 euros a day. 3 English channels (all news) On the positive side: Rooms are pretty generous. Its a good area with good links and I could walk to the centre pretty easily (20 mins). The fitness area was reasonable with free weights. I'm not sure of other hotels but if I came to Madrid it would be 50/50 if I used the hotel again. It just feels like you pay decent money but the hotel is looking to extract more and more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marja-Alain
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, a little bit outside the center, but due to the perfect public transport in Madrid, it does not matter, even from the airport, the subway bring you there in 25 minutes . Infrastructure, service and breakfast are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel,excellent service,great room,met my expectations!Stay here”
Reviews.Author: TinaMGonzalez
Reviews.Content: You definitely get what you pay for, and it is a beautiful hotel, great rooms, not too small considering it's europe. The carpet is clean, mattresses are soft and nice lines. Fluffy bathroom towels and robes. The serve a great buffet breakfast, complete with hams, sardines, fruits, cereals, breads...The service from the concierge is great,he can recommend where to go to eat or what to see. The front desk staff is also very welcoming and friendly. The metro stops are just a block away. so it's easy to get to the tourist sites. It's not close if you walk by foot. It's a bit far for walking to the hot spots, its a little out of the way,but if you use the metro, it's easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBD
Reviews.Content: A birthday treat for my wife and she wasn't disappointed. The IC is situated in a peaceful and upmarket part of the City with excellent links to the Old City and Airport. The metro station is a couple of mins walk away, with an excellent network that is cheap & very safe to use (city centre 10 mins , Airport 20-25 mins) , runs until around 1.30am. We had a Club room , a decent sized room with a very comfortable bed, large flatscreen TV with the usual channels, complimentary water (but no fruit basket !!). Nice bathroom & shower with a separate room for the toilet and bidet. The room was air conditioned (34C outside) overlooking the courtyard, so very quiet. We also had access to the Club lounge offering the usual freebies and ambiance. Very good breakfast, an excellent opportunity to sample the Iberian Ham for free!! They even have an egg menu - given the choice of local produce, artisan breads, fish, fruit I skipped the usual cooked breakfast. The service was first rate , friendly and very helpful at every level and not because we were staying in a club room. We definitely want to return to Madrid for a longer visit and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk lady terrible”
Reviews.Author: yerry_yang_1
Reviews.Content: Lady at reception gave us twin beds. We wanted a single bed so they told us to check the next day. Unfortunately, the man who was working on it was interrupted by the young lady who wanted to tell us we don't know what we asked for, don't know what kind of rooms they have, and that she gave us what we originally booked. While I beg to differ what we booked, it was clear what we asked for. Why would you argue about what we had booked, when regardless of that we wanted a change. Rather than continue to have her tell us we didnt know what we asked for. I hope management understands why we ate two dinners, two breakfasts and two lunches at the Villa Magna and not here. I also hope the concierge, maids and bellman understand she ruined their tips. How simple this would have been with one, simple positive interaction instead of a pointless argument.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Nimu
Reviews.Content: Loved every aspect of the hotel. We had the opportunity to stay here early this month and we loved it! We had booked and paid for accomodation and American breakfast (which was great with an option of champagne and cavier for those that fancy that!). We also got an upgrade to a Club room which was quite a pleasant delight. The staff are very attentive and ready to make your stay comfortable. The only downside was when we got home we realized there was a pre-authorization that they had make on our credit card despite the fact that we had paid in full through our travel agent for the duration of our stay! That made my husband and I upset as they did not even tell us that they had done that and only after several phone calls back to the hotel that they told us what they had done. It slightly mire that part of the trip for us. We are still waiting for it to drop. Other then that, a wonderful to stay. Just watch out for the pre-authorization and enquire how much they are making one for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located business hotel”
Reviews.Author: RhinelandAway
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night. It is a top-class business hotel with a great hall/bar (behind reception). I found the room very small, and at close to 200 euros per night not exactly a good deal. The staff is friendly, although the reception areas is small and usually involves some waiting time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great area but noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Jtung74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental Madrid for 2 nights for leisure. Overall it's a good hotel but unfortunately my rooms were too noisy for sleep. Location: The hotel is not located in the very centre of Madrid, but personally I feel the location is much better than the noisy touristy city centre. It's an upmarket area in Madrid and you can easily walk to the city centre. Serrano, the famous shopping street, is only few minute walk away. It's also easy accessible to the airprot. Public area: public area in the hotel is very well decorated and clean, very comfortable and inviting. We ate at the bar once, and the service was great (wasn't too impressed with most of the restaurants in Madrid). And of cousre it comes with a price. Service: very efficiency but the reception desk is somehow bit small to cope with 300 rooms. Nevertheless I didn't have to wait for more than 5 minutes either for my check in or check out. Concierge desk is mostly manned and the people are professional and have good local knowledge. Very friendly as well which is consistent in all Intercontinental hotels. Room: I was given my first room. It's decent room size with double sink. The room was comfortable, with a lot of information available. There is also a sunny balcony overlooking the restaurant in the courtyard. However at midnight we could hear the musick and feel the vibration from the wedding in the banqueting room. Called receptionist and was told the wedding would not finish until 4am. They were very quick to response and gave me access to another room far away from the banqueting hall. I was impressed with the efficiency. The second room was on a high floor, with a small double bed, a single sink in the bathroom and no balcony. It's absolutely fine with me since I only needed a bed to sleep and the new room was as comfortable as the previous one. The nightmare started early in the morning when housekeeping staff started working. The room was next to a storage of the housekeeping and throughout the morning (6ish until midday) I could hear door banging, loud talking etc. Overall I still think this is a good hotel with good quality. You just need to ensure that you get a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot to say......”
Reviews.Author: My2Cents15
Reviews.Content: There's really not a lot to say about this hotel. I was in madrid for 2 days (basically in and out). This hotel was the closest to my company's Madrid office. This hotel made me feel strange, like I was an unwelcomed guest. Let me try to explain.....No one said anything to me the entire time I was there, only when I checked in or checked out. Usually when I stay at a hotel, you are bombarded by everyone, especially the frontdesk. The frontdesk didn't say anything at all to me. I felt like I could have been Sandra Bullock's character in the "Net". If I disappeared from the hotel, no would remember seeing me there in the first place. Again, this hotel made me feel strange. What I noticed? The room was clean, and lobby was nice. Room service prices was insane. I was starving when I got there; ordered a burger; 40 USD (about 30 Euro. Because this was business trip I needed internet access, 27 EUR for two days (crazy). The location of the hotel was very good. Close to the metro and shopping. If I'm on a short business trip, I would stay here again. However, I wouldn't stay here while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid spring trip”
Reviews.Author: tacph
Reviews.Content: The negative side: I am a wheelchair user and had booked a room for handicapped with a connecting room for my assistance, however, rooms were connected but the door was blocked by a TV etc, My room was very small so I could not get around the beds with my wheelchair, the toilet was very low, so it was difficult to get up, the shower space was very narrow, and the beds very small, so I felt down from the bed one night. I had a voucher for one free weekend night, but they did not accept the voucher because I had not booked the rooms over the internet which is not possible when you need a handicap equipped room, which was not designed by an expert. The positive side: My room had an emergency call system which I had to use when I felt out of the bed. Two men came right away and helped me up in the bed again. Very good service. The service in the lounge was very helpful and friendly. So was the service from the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Poodey
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves booked into the InterContinental via lastminute.com's 'top secret hotels' offer, with 50% off. It's a very corporate hotel, extremely efficient, polite and professional service. We didn't have breakfast included in our deal so can't comment on the quality of the food, but our experience in the hotel bar was very pleasant. The hotel is about a 2 min walk from the Gregor Manon metro, which has good connections to the airport, the west of the City, the Latina areas etc. If you don't take the metro, it's about a 20 minute walk to Plaza de Colon, about 30 mins to Paseo de Prado etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experiance in a great neighboorhood!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1CaliforniaSun
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in excellent hotels throughout the world and this has to be one of the best in a long time. The attention to detail, the professional and very friendly staff and the location were all just right.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: oceanaver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful vacation in Spain. We stayed at the INtercontinental Hotel and just loved it! There was nothing to be critical of, from the lovely, immaculate rooms, beautiful lobby and expert concierge service to the friendly doormen and front desk. I had read an earlier Tripadvisor review and I couldnt disagree more, that it was a terrible Intercontinental. I don't know how you could improve on this gracious and beautifully maintained luxury hotel. Walking distance to marvelous restaurants , easy access to the metro and upscale shops, the situation was ideal. Bravo!!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service”
Reviews.Author: wre3
Reviews.Content: Try to avoid staying here where possible. For the money you pay the service is awful. Staff were unhelpful, unable to communicate, poor at English, towels and supplies in the room were not replenished, the dressing gown and bed linen had holes in them, room service food was barely edible - and my favourite was the 'instant service' button on the phone - there was nothing instant about the service! Sometimes they wouldn't answer the phone and if the lady or man who answered didn't speak English they would simply hang up! I couldn't face asking for an iron and ironing board so wore my shirt creased under my suit jacket! Also no TV channels in English, room was small and my view from the window was of a wall! Windows hardly opened so room was stuffy. Saturday night and Sunday night the hotel lobby and corridors were full of drunk people from functions in the hotel and generally made for an unpleasant atmosphere. After paying a small fortune to stay there you then had to pay to use their internet - in youth hostels this would be free! On the plus side there was one man at reception who was quite genial and pleasant, but that's the only postitive I can think of!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: srbjsim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for five nights and were quite disappointed. The first night of our stayed was fine until the second night then it become miserable. The room was very hot and stuffy with hardly any air coming through the fan which lead to opening the window during the day and night during our stay which didn't help much. On the second day I went to complain and was told the air conditioning is not turned on until the summer so I ask to have remove the heavy down comforter to be replace with a light blanket and to have the fan check to see why barely any air was coming out. No mention mention from the front desk to even change to a different room. We got back to the room after a full day trip and the room seemed to be a little cooler. During the night the room seemed to get very warm again and for the next few nights we had very sleepless nights because of the fan not functioning again. The next to the last day my wife went to complain this time about the room Now we were offered to changed rooms! Why did that not offer this after we complain the first time? We decline knowing we were leaving the next day and had someone come to the room to check the problem again. Well, the last night we seem to have a cool room again. Our problem should have been resolved the first time we complained but wasn't. The positive of our stay was Alfredo at the Concierge Desk. He was so helpful and informative in our stay . Also, I would like to point out that the bed was very uncomfortable for a 5* Star hotel. You could hear the springs when you got in and out of the bed. Forgot to mention everyone we ask about the settings for the thermaostat seem to have a different answer.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality with added luxury”
Reviews.Author: mehrdadnb
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Madrid is just another gem in ICH hotels group. The hotel itself is quite elegant , well decorated in a rather calm area of Madrid. as an Ambassador I received and upgrade and the related stuff which was nice . the staff are nice , polite and extremely helpful. The room was great, large and clean. Bathroom was great too with separate shower and bath, great water pressure.Breakfast was amazing. Totally enjoyed and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Worth upgrading to the Club rooms!”
Reviews.Author: CaseyandSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in Aug'10 and 2 nights in Sep'10 as part of a short trip to Spain. The hotel was booked for us by our travel agent in Australia and we took the opportunity to upgrade to the Club rooms which were very good value - even allowing for the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of luxury and fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: tm_smile
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of January for two nights. As an Ambassador, I received an upgraded room as part of my program, and it ended up being a double upgrade into a Club room. Unfortunately club access was not extended to me (which while I did not expect but thought was a little strict). The room while not the most modern but is immaculately furnished and the bed is fantastic. Bathroom was great too - seperate shower and bath, great water pressure. Had a little bit of trouble with the TV on the last night - was watching a movie on demand (courtesy of program benefit) and the movie froze. Didnt seem like a very interesting movie so didnt bother to call up about it. TV is still old CRT style (in need of an update). Also, internet is very expensive, so i didnt use - 20euros a day). Staff were helpful and polite during my stay, no issues. House keeping left the room immaculate and spotless - could not fault them. As i left very early in the morning, i ended up leaving my travel adaptor and iphone charger in the room, so upon arriving home in Australia, i emailed them and was promtly sent my items back in a package to me free of charge. Thoroughly impressed with the customer service as postage from spain to Aus for a package of that size is not cheap! Hote is not right in the city centre, but steps away from the metro and Madrid's metro is cheap and easy to navigate. Right on Paseo de la Castellana which is a beautiful stroll down towards city centre/main train station. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildriceman
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 5 nights using our Priority Club points and received a double upgrade room.It was not the biggest room we have ever stayed in but the quality was great. Do not eat or drink in the hotel for two reasons: 1. It is VERY expensive 2. there are better places close to the hotel offering good local food and much cheaper it is very close to the Metro station and travelling around Madrid is very easy and economical.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff in Club Intercontinental Lounge”
Reviews.Author: TuanBesar69
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in order to use up a Free Weekend Night coupon that comes with Priority Club Ambassador membership but was informed that the policy of allowing presentation upon arrival was changed to one requiring pre-notification. So, it ended up costing us double what we expected. Probably would have stayed at our friends' Madrid favorite, The Wellington, if we had known. We normally reserve a Club Room at Intercons because, with the free breakfast and Happy Hour , it is good value and the Club Lounge staff are normally very attentive. Not the case in Madrid. Club Lounge staff were aloof and inattentive. The Lobby Staff at the Front Desk and Concierge couldn't have been nicer, however. Did get upgraded to a Jr. Suite but it was strangely configured with two very small rooms. Would have preferred a large deluxe king. Hotel location not the best, either, being quite far from the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the worst Interconti in Europe”
Reviews.Author: billhelm01
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal in Europe, and prefer to use IHG Hotels, since the points system offers the best deal in my opinion. I have deliberately opted out of the Interconti Ambassador program, because that is just a complete rip-off in my opinion. I do have Plat on Priority Club since quite a while now, and that usually gets me a friendly welcome, and even an upgrade at most hotels. Not at this establishment, I can tell you. The last three hotels I stayed in were Interconti Bucharest, Interconti Prague and now Interconti Madrid. Madrid was of course double the price of all the others, but not even half of the value. The staff are demur, unhelpful and generally depressing people to have to deal with. Don't beleive the marketing hype, this hotel is in the middle of nowhere. It's a 10 minute walk to the metro, (which is not the safest place to be after dark anyway) and after that an average of 20 minutes before you get to Sol, the start of the historical center of Madrid. THe standard (or superior as they call it) room was small, I received no upgrade, no club access, no internet and no breakfast for my 200EUR per night rate. Sadly there is nowhere near this hotel to eat breakfast. I would rather go without than pay this hotel a single penny more to be honest.. and it's not even my money! This also explains the queue of taxis waiting outside of this hotel day and night. FOrtunately I hired a car (having already had the experience of being ripped off by a Madrid taxi driver on a previous visit) but the parking in this hotel is extortion, simple and pure. I can only imagine how they expect to get repeat business. I think they are living in the past somewhat. I noticed 5 elderly staff on reception and three aged doormen all idle. Also, the hotel bars and restaurants are generally overpriced as a rule of thumb, but here they live that to the max. It was a mistake to choose this hotel, the management clearly has little repect for it's paying guests. Also, no pool, no sauna, expensive and slow internet, nowhere near anything interesting apart from the metro station. I decided to stay in this hotel while on a business trip in order to check it out as a possible later venue for a short break with my wife. Definitely a no-go. I won't be back ever. .

Reviews.Title: “They delivered.”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed148107
Reviews.Content: I am an Intercontinental royal ambassador member and every single IC hotel will tell you we are the must difficult category of guest to satisfy. To be honest i have nothing to criticise about this property,they delivered from the moment i stepped in to the moment i left,my upgrade and all benefits were met and i can only congratulate the club lounge staff. as for the grumbling guest not being able to have a Coke at breakfast or taking a coke out of the club i will just tell him we are in Europe not the states where guest carry inn pizzas and mac donald to their room and guest begin just by taking a coffee out from the lounge then they will carry a whole familly breakfast,rules have to be strict and applied. i will certainly return to this property,one of the best in IC portfolio.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: baiano59
Reviews.Content: Small room, not too smart. Wasn't too clean. Room wasn't serviced while I stayed there, about 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: globalswede
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to complain about. Fantastic bed with pillows that makes one fall asleep rightaway. A club lounge open 0700-2300 with a perefect breakfast, fast internet, a large variety of newspapers, decent wine and good nibbles. Le Jardin restaurant that provides good food, a concirge that is efficient in service and a door man that really knows where one should go when taking a taxi. An Intercontinental that did all possible for making my 7 night stay being perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Poor Location (for leisure)”
Reviews.Author: worldly_wise86
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to Madrid for business that's the hotel for you but for leisure... I don't know. you need to grab a taxi wherever you go. Not even 1 coffee shop or restaurant close. The hotel is very nice, the room I got was kida small but I asked to have another one that was amazing. some of the rooms have balconies, just ask for it - same price.

Reviews.Title: “Most conflicted hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: jonjindpls
Reviews.Content: I am certainly conflicted in writing this email. Some parts of our stay were exceptional, but several issues occurred that made writing upon our return seem appropriate. We arrived early in the morning and were allowed to have an early check in as well as deciding to upgrade to a club room. We went to the club lounge and had breakfast (which was very good). We went to our room and found it to be great and tried to catch up on some sleep. The following morning, I checked my bank account and found that a hold had been placed on my debit card for $3070 us dollars for a 6 night pre-paid stay (we had pre-paid via priceline). I travel extensively for business and never recall a hold of almost 3x the cost of the entire stay being placed on a card. When enquiring at the front desk, I finally got someone to admit that the amount was high and that they would see what they could do. I would expect the hold to be in the $1000-$1500 range- but $3000??? The hold did not disappear until we returned home and significantly affected our ability to spend on the trip. The next day, during breakfast in the Club Lounge, I requested a Diet Coke as I do not drink coffee. Diet Cokes are free during lunch and dinner hours. I was rudely told that it was only for lunch and dinner hours, but he relented and brought one. I came back about an hour later and watched a family order 4 cokes and their request was granted without the nastiness that I encountered. The following day, I was enjoying breakfast, when I thought it would be nice to take my wife a cup of coffee, but was told "you can't take anything out of the lounge". Again the policy is understandable, but it is a cup of coffee, not two bottles of wine and a plate of food. I just fail to see why in light of the fact the hotel has $3000 on hold, why it should be a major issue to take a cup of coffee back to the room. I'm paying almost $100 per day for the privilege of the club lounge. On Saturday night, I went to the hotel bar for a cocktail. As per my usual, I ordered a double Makers Mark- which I drink at home. The cost for the drink was 32 euros, almost enough to purchase 2 bottles of Makers Mark. Jack Daniels (a comparable spirit) is 15 euros per bottle just a block down the street. The Mini-bar pricing and room service pricing was also the highest I have ever seen. That includes staying at Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, Orient Express and almost every major high end property chain. At midnight on Saturday, a loud wedding reception with a band began in the ballroom below, treating us to 3 hours loud music. When calling the office, we were told there was nothing that could be done, but the music would end at 3 a..m. We went to the front desk the following morning, and were offered apologies and a comment that there would be no music that night, but nothing else. We were miserable for an entire day of touring due to the lost sleep. Later that night, the front desk sent up a bottle of wine and chocolate, a nice touch, but a 9 euro bottle of wine and a few chocolates do not make up for a miserable vacation day. On the second to last day, I requested to exchange some dollars for euros. The going exchange rate was in the low 1.30’s and the hotel exchange rate was 1.59. The train station (which typically offers the worst rates in town) was lower than this. I stay in enough high end properties to know when I am being gouged, and this was clearly one of those times. I am not a frequent complainer, but enough happened during this stay that I felt the need to write. I am not sure what sort of satisfaction guarantee Intercontinental offers, but clearly the stay failed to satisfy us. I should have talked to management prior to leaving, but the language barrier seemed to get worse when handling these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old world elegance”
Reviews.Author: KarenandScott
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several nights with my husband and son on the way to a conference ... beautiful elegant old world style hotel with exquisite bathrooms luxe bedrooms and perfect service ..

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Nuristanoply
Reviews.Content: The ICM was clean. The cleaning staff is second to none. The room was spotless. The front desk staff and door staff were not very friendly. The breakfast bar is wonderful. The fitness center is very nice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wherever the cheap fares take me
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location. Great club and staff. Rooms a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: antonius66
Reviews.Content: This is the third stay we have had here, the first being superb but marred by an incident with an outrageous phone bill. However, this time, knowing to stay away from the room phone, we had no issues. We received club access and enjoyed it immensely as always. This is my favorite Intercontinental club of any of the ones I have been to (Vienna, Tokyo Bay, Tokyo ANA, San Francisco, surely some I forget..). The breakfast is great with fresh OJ (my favorite part), tortilla, a variety of meats, cheeses, pastries, excellent fresh fruit, teas, coffees, etc. The room was excellent with a very soft and comfortable bed. The location is great, as it is near the Prado and other Paseo de la Castellana based sites. Also, it is a 5 minute walk to the metro station where one can easily get anywhere in the city. My only gripes this time are that first, the rooms still have old tube TVs which are hideous in appearance and picture. Come on, IC Madrid, it is 2010 (almost 2011)...get with some LCD TVs please. The television are dated and show it in their quality. Second, there are no light switches inside the bathroom, only 1 light switch on the outside of the bathroom. Thus, if you forget to hit the switch in the night, you must exit the bathroom and turn it on, and also, you cannot turn on light in say, just the toilet area which is usually closed off with a door. You have to light up the whole bathroom area and you must do it from outside the bathroom. Minor gripes though, and overall no issues this time. Staff were friendly, housekeeping did not come in the room or knock even though we left the do not disturb sign up all day once (some hotels do this which is my MAJOR irritant). Overall a great stay and worth the price paid, which was very reasonable all things considered.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Passenger86
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great locations, right in the middle of the financial district which is an asset for business people like me travelling for business purposes. The service is excellent and staff make you feel great to be back there. Small but cosy restaurant for breakfast, very good food at the bar and a busy but classy atmosphere all day long. Nice Club Lounge with dedicated staff. Rooms are spacious and well furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Fido100607
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple weeks for work. A nice hotel with good staff. The breakfast was good every morning, and the internet was very fast as well. The location is really nice too. Close to 2 metros and a bus line, but not right in the heart of things so it was fairly quiet. Some good restaurants and shopping nearby too. The rooms are all nice, fairly new and everything clean and comfortable. My only two complaints are the rooms next to the elevators are VERY loud (I asked to be switched and they did) and I don't think they really valued be as a PC Ambassador member (no water or fruit). Overall, a great hotel and I will probably be back at some time in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Opulence at a price!”
Reviews.Author: MP1Dublin
Reviews.Content: This certainly hotel is certainly opulent, in fact almost regal in it's appearance but such decadence comes at a premium price! It is rather expensive and we'd never have considered staying here until we got a fantastic "secret hotel deal" on lastminute.com which came as a hugely welcome surprise. It enabled us to upgarde to a Club room for €75 extra per nite while keeping the total cost of our stay within their normal charge for a standard room only. This was truly excellent value as it provides Club Lounge privildges which include free food and refreshements all day long from breakfast through to 9pm. Breakfast alone in the hotel costs €32 for two (i think) and drinks at the bar are outrageously expensive. Unlike the Hilton Executive lounges we've enjoyed in the past, beer and wine, including cava are available all day but sadly there are no spirits for those who like hard liqour! Also the range of food was not quite as extensive. We were astonished to discover that the limited hot food offerings which comprised only two dishes, fish and meat were exactly the same both nights and we were also a little disappointed with the hot breakfast items which were luke warm at best but tasty none-the-less. We really are splitting hairs here because despite these minor disappointments the club lounge was a superb vantage point to sit and relax, coccooned in comfort as people scurry past and cars whizz up and down the Paseo de la Castellana. The Hotel is two minutes walk from Gregorio Maranon metro station at the top of Paseo de la Castelllana which is a long broad tree-lined thorough-fare leading directly into the city centre, a very pleasant twenty minute stroll in the afternoon sun. Turn right at Banc de Espana to get to Puetra del Sol. A taxi from the airport cost €27 and the metro journey back to the airport took under one hour. The hotel entrance, lobby and bar are extremely elegant as are the spacious bedrooms and bathrooms. No wi-fi but there is a free high speed plug in connection. Drinks from the minin bar are extorionate. €5 for a coke, same for water and €6.50 for local beer (€7 for heineken) - very dear! Best of all was undoubtedly the supremely comfortable bed which was so luxurious that we actually over-splet and missed breakfast the first morning. Service was superb from reception to housekeeping and the highly professional Club Lounge staff with the exception of one guy who repeatedly took calls and messages on his moblie - again we're splitting hairs here. We had a wonderful relaxing stay in the Intercontinental. It is trully worthy of 5 stars but we'd only return if the price is right. We'd highly recommend it if price is not a issue for you! (We'd really prefer if the Hilton had a presence in downtown Madrid but their only option is remotely located near the airport!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Everything you need for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: Kelly-Marie1984
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. The staff were very welcoming and friendly I have never received service like I have here. The room were a little dated but the beds were extremely comfortable with a pillow menu which was great. Metro line 5 minute walk from the hotel so could travel around the city very easily. I loved my time in Madrid the best city break by far! We watched a Joy Division night with Peter Hook singing which was a once in a life time opportunity can't remember the name of the club but was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: wp72
Reviews.Content: We chose the Intercontinental as our first hotel for a three-week European vacation and other hotels had a lot to live up to after our stay here. We requested and received a wine and cheese welcome tray (extra charge) that was a very nice touch. Our room was more along the lines of an "American" hotel room....roomy, spacious, king sized bed. The front desk staff and concierge were courteous and very helpful with sightseeing tips. The breakfast was FABULOUS! The hotel was located very near the Plaza del Sol and everything was a fairly easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “INTERCONTINENTAL HOTELS DELIVERS”
Reviews.Author: MIAMA123
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in this hotel since the early 90's, and coming back after several years not coming to Madrid, I found a very well appointed Inter, with an excellent patio restaurant, which I recommend the hotel keeps it open all day till closing. The rooms, large and comfortable as always, but newly upgraded. We had a room facing Castellana, and you could hardly hear any noise from outside. The Club, one of the best I have seen at InterContinental hotels. The Nespresso machine is top of the line. I will continue to comeback to the Inter in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great Club Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: LA_Engineer
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was perfect for my wife and our daughter's summer vacation to Spain. The hotel is well located, 5 minute walk to the metro, which for 1 euro you can go to anywhere in Madrid. Very clean. A little small, but okay. As mentioned by others my daughter's extra bed cost an extra 65 euros per night, but thanks to Trip Advisor I was expecting this charge. Staff is very firendly and professional. One of the best things is the Club Lounge. It is well worth it to become a Priority Club Member (free to join). We ate all our breakfasts there, and as mentioned by others, its fantastic. You can also eat throughout the day till 10pm at night. We ate many lunches and dinners there for free. (We did leave a 5 euro tip at each meal, but I think most people don't). The Priority Club promotions also gave us 1 night free for the one week stay as well as 100 euro to spend in the hotel restaurants. One meal consumed the 100 euro so you can see that outside this lounge the meals are a bit pricey. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and appearance but considerable room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: emaildave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend and although this is undoubtedly a nice hotel we didn’t feel it was up to the standard of some of the other Intercontinental hotels in Europe. The hotel is superbly located and we were upgraded without question from a club room to a nice junior suite. We took breakfast in the club lounge which was a lavish affair and had drinks and tapas there in the evening. The concierge and doormen were very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately this is probably where the positives end. Upon returning to our room on the second day we found our door key not to be working and upon enquiring with the receptionist it appeared our reservations had not been correctly linked (1 paid night, 1 Ambassador BOGOF voucher night and 1 night on points). We were asked if we were checking out as a result and the receptionist took some convincing and explaining to let us back into our room! On the third day we had a phone call again asking if we were checking out – these guys obviously still hadn’t worked it out and this time the receptionist bluntly told us out of the blue that we would have to pay if we wished to use the club lounge for the final evening! We really felt as if we were being ‘hounded out of the hotel’. Despite asking several times the hotel did not appear to be able to deliver a complimentary newspaper. When one did arrive on the second day it was missing several key sections and was purely a photocopy. We had to ask for the Ambassador complimentary fruit basket and water and when it did arrive it consisted of just 3 pieces of fruit! Finally, although we had a nice room on the fifth floor it definitely lacked good quality double/triple glazing and was very noisy from the traffic outside. The TV was very dated and the complimentary tea & milk wasn’t replenished after the first day. There was no soap in two out of the three dispensers in the toilets next to the lounge, the service in the lounge when we were allowed in was pretty poor and it was far too overcrowded with people at the weekend – probably as a result of the receptionist not really appearing to check who went in and out! This is a certainly a nice hotel but one with considerable room for improvement. I wouldn’t recommend going to the hotel and relying upon Ambassador or Priority Club benefits as we were later told they didn’t apply to stays paid for with points.

Reviews.Title: “Very Consistent , Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NonStopTraveller
Reviews.Content: The location of the metro station beside this hotel is key.You can get in from the airport in 30 minutes and can be at any meeting so easily by underground train. The Gym is small but good, the bar is nice and spacious , the rooms are good and staff are friendly. Overall no surprises and no complaints , helps so much just to get on with the job. Just 10 minutes from Puerto del Sol on the metro , so easy to get out for a bit of craic in the evening as well , and get home .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Pensi0ner
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely w/e staying at this hotel for an anniversary. The staff were brilliant. Very friendly and helpful. Was slightly worried by previous review saying it wasn't central. No, it's not right in the middle of things, but it is in a very pleasant leafy, quiet location. An attractive courtyard for drinks and super breakfast made up for that. I think someone said you needed taxis everywhere...rubbish! Get off your backside. A few minutes walk from the excellent metro, (then only 2/3 stops for central area) and the same for the tourist bus .A ticket for 2 days took you to the sightseeing areas. You could get off and on at will and cross over onto the other circular route if you wished. Madrid is a beautiful city and you could easily see the tourist sights from this hotel. Our room was small (super bathroom), but we did have a cheap package. My only gripe was having to pay over 5euros for a small bottle of water from the minibar. This standard of hotel should provide one each for free every night. I would go back if we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Almatt
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We booked our flights and the hotel as a package with British Airways and feel that it was excellent value for money. We booked a Club Room and were very pleased that we did. I have read a couple of negative comments about the food etc in the Club Lounge but we have no complaints at all. Our room was on the 6th floor and had a balcony overlooking an interior court yard. Not the most spectacular view but it meant that it was very quiet with no traffic noise. The large bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was well equipped with a large shower as well as the bath, double sinks, separate toilet etc and it was immaculately clean as you’d expect for a hotel of this standard. All of the staff we encountered were polite, helpful and friendly – queries we had before our visit were promptly answered too. The breakfast in the Club lounge was excellent – if you are expecting a cup of coffee and a bread roll then think again! There were eggs, bacon, sausages etc as well as an array of rolls, bread and pastries plus fruit, cheese, cooked meats, cereals and so on. It certainly set us up for the day. Throughout the day there was a continuous supply of canapés, cakes as well as drinks (tea, coffee, soft drinks, beer and wine) and at 7pm some hot food was also available. I had wondered if we would find the location a problem but it wasn’t and actually I think that being away from “party central” was a good thing. There are two Metro stops close to the hotel (Ruben Dario on Line 4 which takes you to Chueca, Gran Via in a couple of stops and Gregorio Maranon on Line 10 which gives easy access to the Bernabeu Stadium). The Metro is cheap, safe and easy to use. The open top bus stops near Ruben Dario Metro and there are plenty of local buses passing outside of the hotel. A taxi from the hotel to Santa Ana cost 7 Euros and one to the airport cost 25 Euros. If anybody has any queries send me a message and I’ll be happy to answer you. We would recommend this hotel and will choose to stay here again if we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Likeitniceandclean
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and it was a great experience. The rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. The staff is very nice and the breakfast was great. Would definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SandDragon
Reviews.Content: The last stop of our brief trip to Spain and Portugal - having done a lot of driving I was after some dependable quality of a 5 star big name brand hotel. As a frequent guest of Intercons (predominantly on business) I booked three nights in a Club Room. I fully admit my mistake - this is not a hotel for tourists and we would have been much better staying elsewhere. However, I still had expectations which were not met. My gripes: Room not prepared and fairly old and daggy Breakfast was dismal (although in a reasonmably nice outdoor setting) and service was worse than amateur - difficult to get their attention, could not hit a coffee cup with the coffee and no apology for sending it everywhere, loud discussions between staff over the top of our table, hot food choices were very limited, no toast Very limited food/snack selections in Club Lounge Oldest TV I have seen in a hotel for many years On-screen bill scared the heck out of me when it indicated I had a Euro 15,000 bill waiting 2 of 4 computers in business centre didn't work, nor did our in-room wifi No recognition of Priority Club membership/status I am still not sure whether the laundry we sent out was actually washed or only partially pressed Extra bed and parking charges were the highest I have paid anywhere (and it was the only hotel we stayed in Spain and Portugal that even levied them). Of course this is their right and it was adequately disclosed in the fine print However, the concierge guys were great and expremely helpful. Far below what I would expect from an Intercontinental. A two to three star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: John_S23455
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the InterContinental Madrid. As the last city in our tour of Europe, we were looking to unwind in comfort and the InterContinental did not disappoint my wife and I. She wrote in her jornal that we had saved the best for last and indeed we had. The service is unsurpassed and the room was large by american standards. The bedding was fresh and extreamly comfortable. The double vanity marble bath was just icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but out of the way and pricey”
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel with well furnished rooms and very clean public areas . The biggest fault we had was the location as its based nearer the business district and a fair walk from any places of interest , not a problem if you arent wanting to see much of the city but if you are then its taxis everwhere ! Food was good in the hotel but we found drinks very expensive ( circa £12 for a beer!) For a supposed 4/5Star the leisure facilities were very poor and no pool or any decent gym seems lacking for modern city hotel of this standard The concierges and front of house staff were good and helpful and all the room maids were all cheerful and acknowldeged guests . In summary this hotel is aimed at people on business and on expenses who arent going to want to or have the time to do much sight seeing

Reviews.Title: “World's best concierges”
Reviews.Author: harold6
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I checked in for a flying visit - a long weekend in Madrid. It goes without saying that the hotel was beautiful - but I wanted to make special mention of the service. The Concierge team were faultless - in our case it was the pursutie of our lost luggage thanks to Iberia (NEVER fly with them!). The concierge team were seamless... where on finished work, the other picked up - always briefing each other and keeping us informed. Alfredo in particular was patient, charming and informed. It's a little way into town, but in the heat you can't beat a cab - even the drivers are friendly! A great stay in a fab hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place that not even words can describe it”
Reviews.Author: Kss016
Reviews.Content: Awesome place with great service! I loved the location and room. The rooms were very clean and very well equipped. Also, the consiguer service was great! If you are in Madrid and want a great place to stay in then this is it. I slept like a baby when I was there.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: chonga7780
Reviews.Content: This hotel absolutely delivered on the great reputation the Intercontinental brand holds. The staff were consistently warm, welcoming & helpful. They had great knowledge & advice in terms of things to see & do, and would kindly follow up in the evening to see if we had enjoyed the day. Our room was immaculate, spacious & comfortable - what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. Very pretty & elegant decor! For shoppaholics - definitely a hotel to consider. This hotel is conveniently located about a 5 minute walk to Salamanca, a long street with no shortage of designer labels & up-market Spanish boutiques. You will also find many cafes & restaurants along this strip as well. For those who prefer more accessible fashion, it's a few subway stations away from areas Gran Via & Sol. The location was great in the way that it allowed us to remove ourselves away from the hectic tourist crowds, but it was easy enough to travel and be in the centre of the crowd when we felt like it! If we have to pick a flaw, then it would have to be the cost of WiFi - $25AUD per hour - very expensive considering WiFi is actually widely available across Europe and not a rare service. After having stayed at several other Intercontinental hotels during my long European trip, we have begun to accept that this just the way they price their internet service, no matter what country. Overall a fantastic stay, and we would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “The place in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Pigma
Reviews.Content: Do not doubt it if you can afford it. Top 5 star hotel with a "Movie" Lobby and great staff. Since the moment you enter by the door, Carlos will greet you and you wil feel you are in a special place. Staff are great, Bellboys, receptionists, etc... have been working for many years and that is a good signal. The concierge told me he was there for the last 35 years. Room is great and breakfast is expensive 35 Euros per person + taxes. There is a bar beside the hotel"como en tu casa" where you can find bkfst for 2 Euros and you will find also the hotel staff having coffee. as I said, stay ther if you can afford it

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in Madrid .”
Reviews.Author: TonyCardenas
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Intrercontinental hotel at Madrid after a very long trip and , we really enjoyed that our reservation and Priority memebership was honored , the hotel its a beautiful mansion right at the Paeo Castellana , but a bit far from the Museums and the Gran via area , but the place its nice and luxurius , the have a really niceejecutive louge and our room was large and well apppointed , restaurant its very nice and the food its one excellent , the bar in the evenings was crowded with Madrid and forerigh people. i will lov to stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: aman23
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. Not far from the underground station (Metro). You can easily get here from Airport via train, no need to get a taxi. Also the center of town is just 5-8mins train ride away. Starbucks Coffee is across the road & open until 10pm. Also has a few restaurants around the Vicinity. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We felt totally ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: othersfollow
Reviews.Content: We spent an unplanned night in Madrid travelling back to the UK after flight disruption had left us stranded on the coast. We booked a room to accommodate 2 adults and 1 teenager on-line the day before we arrived in Madrid and were quoted a price for a room for 3 people. On arrival the hotel confirmed that we had a room for 3 people but then insisted that if we wanted the 3rd bed, a camp-bed, to be delivered to the room there would be an additional charge of 55 Euros. There was no mention on the website or on the confirmation that the price quoted (250 Euro plus Tax!) for the 3 person room would increase at check in if we actually wanted the third bed! It was late when we arrived and we were very tired, the room only had 2 single beds in it so we had no option but to pay up. Our journey home took 3 days, involved 3 trains and 24hrs on a ferry, everywhere we went people were extremely helpful and straightforward, except of course at the Intercontinental which left an unpleasant feeling of being ripped off. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but have Reservations”
Reviews.Author: Nusiax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental Madrid for a long weekend. Well I have some reservations regarding the hotel. First our check in went smoothly, we were sent to the Club Lounge for Check In, being a Platinum Ambassador. And we were informed that the club lounge buffet was updated through out the day depending on the time and occasion. And we were upgraded to a junior suite. First the room was nice, and very comfortable. The only issue, which was minor was a building support pillar at the end of the bed. But you can live with this. But there was speakers though out the room in ceiling with volume control in each room, But there was no iPod dock or other music system. The TV in the setting room never worked. And the channel selection was very limited, and if you do not speak spanish, then your choice was CNN and BBC World News. But that was okay not there to watch TV, And we had complimentary WiFi for our stay. The cleaning staff was great and very friendly and very responsive. However, the other staff, except for the Manager and Front Desk Manager were very distant and cold at times. And if you did not speak spanish again, you had a hard time communicating, which I found a bit of an issue being in a major international hotel. The Club Lounge was very comfortable, however the buffet serviced breakfast which was fantastic, But then it was changed to snacks. And it did not change the rest of the day, We asked what time cocktails were serviced and we were first told 6 pm. When we showed up at 6 pm and then told it 6:30 pm, When we showed up at 6:30 pm then told 7:30 pm. And at 7:30 cocktails are not provided and had to be ordered from the lobby bar. And the buffet change for cocktails included a plate of cheese and a breaded meat on tooth picks. This represented a full change. Well out decision was the hotel was comfortable and very centrally located out the crowds but close enough to enjoy the sites. However, I would not recommend paying for the club lounge access. Other than the breakfast, was pretty much a waste of time. And I would recommend the hotel with reservations. The staff are a bit cold and unresponsive. The club lounge was a bit disappointing, but the location and room comfort was worth it. So stay and do not expect much in the way of service, and you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: saaba
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in madrid .We booked this hotel because of a special rate and promotion of hotel and also since intercontinental hotels all over the world are known for their 5* services but when we arrived we found a very very small room with poor services and for breakfast they told us we should use a very normal breakfast .the breakfast that they offer us was very poor and all the 7 days always the same.when we ask about it they told our room are normal room with normal service ,just club room have 5*service and breakfast (they had another resturant for breakfast for club rooms)this disappoint my family when saw these differences in hotel . I recommend the passenger who reserve this hotel be sure about the type of room and service if not may be like us find a 5* hotel with very unsadisfied services.

Reviews.Title: “You'll want to land here first...”
Reviews.Author: lisaann6760
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Madrid is luxury at its finest. After an all night flight, I arrived early in the morning and was able to check in right away. The room was exceptional and I had a lovely view an area that just begins a lovely walkway into central Madrid. The concierge was extremely helpful in the subways, trains, and buses trip I took making sure I had good directions and information. I traveled alone and got to see Toledo and Segovia, and I owe my thanks to them! I highly recommend Intercontinental Madrid as a base point for anyone traveling to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. You really feel like you're staying in a 5* rich hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissBLondon
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Stayed here for 3 nights in April - Easter weekend. Any hotel that has a Cartier shop in the lobby has to be a 5*. Room facilities were what you would expect from a good 5* - robes/slippers/hair-dryer/tea/coffee/bottle opener/fridge/iron/bath/shower etc etc The location is quiet as it's in the financial district but the nearest Metro is Ruben Dario only 5 mins walk away and will take you everywhere you need to go for 1 Euro. There's some great little cafes across the road and a short walk down from the hotel. Concierge was fantastic with useful info and free maps. Would definately stay again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and efficiency at the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Framty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental Madrid for one night in a Club InterContinental room. The check-in process was quick and smooth (it is done in the club lounge, located in the first floor of the building). The room itself was big enough for a good sized desk, a king size bed and a chaise longe. The bathroom was big, with separate tub and shower, and there was plenty of storage space too. The equipment of the room was excellent overall, except for the television, not LCD as has become standard in most luxury hotels worldwide. The bath amenities were provided by Elemis. Regarding the Club InterContinental lounge, the installations and services provided were of a good level, and the people at the desk of the lounge were nice and courteous, taking care efficiently of all my requests. Last, the location. In my opinion one of the best in Madrid, but especially for business, not so much for touristic visits to the city. In any case I disagree with previous reviewers that felt unsafe in Madrid in general and in this location in particular. I think the foreign traveller will feel comfrotable and safe in this area providing that respects the obvious security measures we all know. Overall, a luxurious, professionally run and higly recommendable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel! Beware of your credit card details after checking out!”
Reviews.Author: londonn73
Reviews.Content: When checking out please make sure no additional charges have been taken out of your credit card without your authorization! I was dismayed to find out that charges has been incurred without my prior knowledge and without an invoice when I checked out! Contacting Intercontinental hotel customer services has been painful as the freephone customer line does not work! I had to call Holiday Inn instead! Staff at the hotel did not even say hello to you and the whole experience had made me feel disgusted with this hotel brand! I WILL NEVER STAY WITH THIS HOTEL CHAIN AGAIN! PLEASE THINK AGAIN WHEN BOOKING THIS HOTEL IN MADRID!!! It has been most frustrating and painful dealing with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: MissPEI
Reviews.Content: I was given a smoking room and had to go back and get a non-smoking room. There was no apology. I ordered room service and was given undercooked and cold food. The hamburger and fries that I ordered was 36 euros and the hamburger was raw when i specifically asked for well done. I asked them to fix it , so they took the same burger and put it back on the gril and slapped it back to gether with the bite taken out of it. And the fries where ice cold. No apologies. Walls are paper thin and could hear everything going on next door. Could not get to sleep. Overall it was awful and would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but”
Reviews.Author: FLBinFrance
Reviews.Content: A great hotel especially if you get one of their good deals. Superb rooms and well worth it to upgrade to the Club lounge if you can - even at an addition 70 euro a day for two people,its excellent breakfast and refreshments are worth it. As a negative the hotel is a little too far away from the city centre for the tourist but well placed for the business person wanting to be near the financial district. Despite being a 5 star property it only has one restaurant which is not well frequented and therefore offers little atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “5 star? not on your nelly!”
Reviews.Author: Wotski
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 nights over Valentine's weekend. The location is fine, within a short walk of a couple of tube stations that will get you anywhere in Madrid and placed in the business district, which is nice escape from the lively town centre. The hotel doesn't seem to have anything like the facilities, service, room-size or overall quality that you would have every right to expect from a five star; it feels more like three... ...except for the prices, which are laughable. Fancy a beer? That'll be 8 euros sir. How about some breakfast? Only if you're feeling flush to the tune of 30 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TinaL7
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Excellent service, product and location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TuanBesar69
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a deluxe Club Room with a terrace. Very nice, well-equipped room. Lovely bathroom, very comfortable bed & linens, good-size luxury bathroom with Elemis amenities, good wi-fi internet complementary with Club. Elegant Club Lounge with attentive staff and excellent Breakfast Buffet and decent Happy Hour hor's d'oeuvres with wine & cava (spanish champagne). Fitness Center open 24 hrs was well-equipped but no pool, steam or sauna. Great location for walking to to old center of town and along Paseo La Castellana. Found the Concierge, Alfredo Garcia, especially helpful.

Reviews.Title: “First class accomodations and club amenities for the business traveler.”
Reviews.Author: AntonRaphaelMengs
Reviews.Content: I am completing a five-day business trip to Madrid. I’m writing this review after spending the week at the InterContinental Hotel Madrid. I frequently travel from the US to Asia and Europe, both on business and with family. It’s my experience that on week-long trips, the club level accommodations are significantly more comfortable, convenient and even cost-effective. Having much to compare with this hotel’s club accommodations (Conrad Singapore, Hyatt Taipei, Westbury, Dublin, etc.) I give it 5 out of 5. The staff is attentive without being intrusive. The accommodations are very comfortable and the location excellent. It’s an attractive hotel with a buzz in the lobby and a stylish international clientele. My suggestion is to request/require street-side rooms as there are center rooms that may not have an outside view. Without qualification, a recommended hotel for business or family travel. The hotel staff pride is evident and it is obviously well managed. By the way, Madrid has some of the best restaurants I’ve been to.

Reviews.Title: “An OK stay at the Intercontinental Madrid”
Reviews.Author: bibliotecaria313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental Madrid in September 2009 for a total of three nights. We arrived in Madrid on an early morning flight and were able to take the metro from the airport (recommended!) to the Nuevos Ministerios metro stop and walk the rest of the way to the hotel. The walk was safe and refreshing after spending too many hours sitting on the plane -- but be aware that the walk took close to 30 minutes. We arrived at the hotel around 9:00 a.m. and were thrilled to have a room available for us within an hour. The room itself was lovely, relatively large and clean. When we opened the curtains there was *no* view. None. The window was blocked by a large steel panel of sorts. Did it bug us? Not really. We were dead tired from the flight and didn't plan to spend much time in the room. Besides it rained the fews days we were visiting Madrid. The only major complaint to the room was that we flooded the bathroom when we took our showers. On a lesser note, the expensive breakfast truly isn't worth the money -- but no surprise on that. The hotel is not located in a convenient location for taking in the tourist sites, but like others have stated, the metro is within a five minute walk from the hotel. When the weather cleared, we walked to the Prado in about an hour's time. The Paseo de la Castellana made for a beautiful stroll. We returned to the Intercontinental a few days later for a single night before our departure flight home. The room was a little smaller, but it had a cute little balcony overlooking the Paseo de la Castellana (I think). Having used our hotel points in other Intercontinental hotels in Paris and Rome, I can say that using points for the hotel was a good, but not fantastic value. However, I highly recommend Madrid as a vacation destination!

Reviews.Title: “Next time in Madrid ...”
Reviews.Author: tricolor00
Reviews.Content: my wife and I will look for another hotel. We stayed at Intercontinel for two nights. Far from the central area, but near elegant shops. Good breakfast. Professional staff, not friendly. Great conciergere! Terrible room: small and without any view. Never again, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, services lacking.”
Reviews.Author: NWA4EVER
Reviews.Content: sorry i'm very lazy, so I just copy the review format from flyertalk.com, - What is your Priority Club status? Platinum Royal Ambassador - Were you (or for multi-stayers are you generally) happy with the hotel/stay? Very - Which room did you book and which upgrade did you receive? Booked the cheapest room, and got a Senior suite. - How are the rooms? The Room was on the 7th floor with very nice double balcony overlooking the Paseo de la Castellana. The living area and the sleeping area is divided by a rather small door (a double door would have looked much cooler IMO). The room was very nicely decorated, but the TV were rather small and old. Bath room was all marble, very classy, but rather small, with the bath tub tucked behind a supporting piller, which looks pretty odd. Fully stocked amenities with Elmeis products. The mini bar has a pretty good alcohol selection, but only coke and coke light for soft drinks, and six bottles of water. Only the liquids were free for RAs at this IC. - How is the exec. lounge? Lounge was nicely decorated, but a bit on the small size, I thought the tables were way to small, i like to use my laptop while enjoying the snacks during cocktail hours, but it wasn't possible here. The cold food selection was pretty good, but the breakfast was lacking a little bit, the bread sticks with olive oil was amazing. Other than the Club attendant who check me in, attitude of the rest of the staff was somewhat indifferent. - What was good and what was bad? Good: Nice upgrade. Good Location, 2 and a half minute walk to the Metro Free WIFI Internet Bad: Staff was not very friendly, the concierge especially, his first words to me when i walked up was "What do you want". I also had a moment from a family guy episode, I was taking a nap when the maid came in for turn down service, she didn't speak english, and simply won't go away, I almost burst out laughing after she said "I clean now?" in a Spanish accent. - Value for $ or Priority Club Points? Would you return? 120 Euros for the first night, 144 for the second, but i used my BOGO, so overall, a pretty good value, considering the prices of surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service from housekeeping staff”
Reviews.Author: hpmoon
Reviews.Content: Had a perfect stay at the Intercontinental Madrid. I left some items in the room after checking out (confused by room re-arrangements), and the housekeeping staff were extremely communicative and accommodating when sending the items back to me in the United States. As others have noted, the location is not central to the most concentrated activity in Madrid, but it is still very accessible with two different subway lines within a block of the hotel, and a VIPS restaurant across the street that is open somewhat late. Also, bus lines are regularly going up and down Castellena that take you directly to the Prado, the Atocha train station, etc. And the affluent neighborhood is very quiet, which some travelers may prefer. I also interacted with two concierges during my stay and both were very kind; practical and to-the-point, as well as very fluent in English. The room was perfect, immaculate and -- I suspect -- generously upgraded from my reservation tier. Clearly I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant oasis of calm!”
Reviews.Author: Halibut51
Reviews.Content: We had a very fraught drive through Madrid due to an accident closing roads etc. so we were very glad to arrive at the hotel, find a parking space outside and then be enveloped in the tranquility of the hotel and the efficiency of the staff. We had a room on the executive floor so made use of the lounge and drinks and nibbles. We also had the advantage of a 4pm checkout which made the logistics of catching our early evening flight painless. Wifi was free and quick. A super stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but be careful at night”
Reviews.Author: sunflower44_9
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice- in an affluent neighborhood, about 2 miles from the Prado and other tourist attractions. Bed, queen size, was very comfortable. Room itself was laughably small but I'm guessing they gave us one of the smallest rooms because we found a fabulous rate on hotwire ($117/night). Shower had great water pressure and bathroom well appointed. Concierge helpful. We went to dinner at an amazing Morrocan place called Mosaiq about 2/3 of a mile away (best Morrocan I have ever had). We decided to walk home. When we were a block and a half away from the hotel, on the main boulevard, a black car pulled up to us and a window rolled down and an angry man dressed in a policeman's "costume" flashed a badge at us and started yelling at us angrily saying "policia policia". He was trying to get us to go over to the car. It was very scary, and my husband and I walked away from them. The men in the car reversed it and pulled up to us again, yelling at us. They stopped harassing us when another pedestrian happened to come by. We were both very scared at the time, not knowing if these people had weopons or if they were going to get out of the car or whatnot. What is crazy is how close we were to the hotel. Madrid has been experiencing a wave of more violent crime lately, and I thought we'd be a little safer in a wealthy neighborhood away from the touristy areas, but clearly we were not. My suggestion is yes, stay in this hotel, but even if your restaurant is nearby and even if it is still early evening, call a cab and maintain vigilance/street smarts at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel night's sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Kite
Reviews.Content: We took the opportunity to stay here for our one night zip through Madrid on the way to Seville, under a Holiday Inn offer from the summer. Taking advice from Trip Advisor we didn't eat in the hotel, but as others have said, the very efficient subway system to get downtown is but a block away, and there is a coffee/breakfast bar just around the corner if you don't wish to eat in. The staff were very helpful and our room was very comfortable. So comfortable that we sank into our beds and morning was there in a flash. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...as always.”
Reviews.Author: Ancon
Reviews.Content: Visited our favorite hotel in Madrid for 4 days. A year had past since our last visit and everything is still as good as our previous stays. Not the best location for a first timer in Madrid but it is a great location if you are willing to walk, take the bus or subway in Madrid. Excellent and confortable rooms and one of the best Club floors Intercontinental has to offer. Be sure to contact Miguel in the Concierge desk for good information on tours or reservations on some of the best restaurants in Madrid or other cities in Spain. A great Corte Ingles department store withing walk distance or a huge one 5 minutes on taxi ride. Always recommend this special hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the extra price”
Reviews.Author: aa442u
Reviews.Content: For the high price you'd expect to have some amenities like free water, free internet, shuttle service. The service varied - it was a bit snooty and accomodated requests only after some begging. A cup of coffee downstairs was 6 euros. The concierge practically snorted when I said I wanted to see a bullfight. Every trip was a 6 euro cab ride minimum. Once we found the nearby Metro stops it was better. Continental breakfast was great and rooms were amazing, but the nitpicking for every amenity drove me crazy. Even the ethernet cord in the minibar costs $ to use! I think I would've prefered to be closer to restaurants and attractions so my older mother could come back to room to rest. Free internet is a must in europe! C'mon people!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Club Level Service”
Reviews.Author: MrsBond923
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely spacious by European standards. The staff was friendly, all spoke excellent English, and were eager to help. Use of the Club was a great way to relax with colleagues after a long day of meetings. I'd recommend highly for both business and personal travel. It may be a pro or a con - the hotel, while in Madrid, it is not located in the center of the old city where most major attractions and museums are located; it is a long walk or short metro/cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and clean”
Reviews.Author: lems94
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this hotel and enjoy it. The food in their restaurant was really good. I ate an paella that I had never eaten.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best Intercontinentals!”
Reviews.Author: HT-Birmingham
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, it was great! Booked a Junior Suite which was on the 2nd floor over looking the main road. Check-in was done in the Club lounge (Ambassador Status), was a bit disappointed with the "welcome", I was asked if I had stayed here before to which I replied "no". Then that was it!! No explaination of the hotel, what facilities, what time was breakfast!! Room was fantasic, seperate lounge area with TV and work desk. Bathroom was nice with seperate bath and shower cubicle. Shower was great after a long day of site seeing. Had access to the Club lounge, which was extremly good value. Breakfast was good but limited. Snacks and drinks were available all day after breakfast. Breakfast did change daily but the snacks were the same for the whole three days!! The Club Lounge did also have one PC, which was free to use and surf the net, it did also have a printer, so was able to check in for the returning flight. Check out was a bit annoying, one of the reservation clerks had increased the price of the booking during the time from when I booked it to check out. So I had to show the original reservation to get the old cheaper rate back!! So make sure you check your bill on check out!
