Staff were nice but very quiet, not very vocal in saying Good morning, Welcome back, Good bye. I must say the door man did need a lesson on how to smile. For the 3 days we were there I dont think he smiled or spoke!! However the hotel is great and must be one of the best Intercontinentals Ive stayed in, Would definately recommended it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mtag28
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to everything what you need to see in Madrid. Take a metro from the airport for only 2 EUROs and you are at the hotel in 25 minutes. Better than the TAXI and the traffic... I will recommend to stay in this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Typical Intercon hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: sandyjb83
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel but it seems very geared towards the business traveler. The location is a bit out of the way if you are a tourist but don't let that deter you. The hotel is located about a 2 minute walk away from the metro station and from there you can go anywhere in Madrid. We got a great rate for the rooms there and had an excellent time. Services and amenities are very expensive at this hotel (20 euros for internet) but if you are there on vacation you probably wont care too much about it anyways. Rooms are pretty nice (larger than usual Euro rooms) and the bathrooms are excellent. Food is very expensive (32 euros for breakfast!) but if you walk about a half mile down the street there is a great little place called the Harvest cafe which has some excellent sandwiches and pastries and an amazing mojito. They also have free wifi should you need it. Nothing really to see in this neighbourhood but its a very nice one nevertheless and is a more upscale residential place. If you are in Madrid, I would very much recommend staying here and buying an all day metro pass (5 euros and change)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but know before you go!”
Reviews.Author: dreaminofnextholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a few days in August on a room only basis. The hotel has large spacious bedrooms which are fully air conditioned (a must during August). The staff are very helpful and are only too happy to help with any questions and supply maps of the area. The bar and lounge areas are also nice and relaxing. Be warned that the prices at the hotel are steep (30 euros each for breakfast) - a short walk around the block will save you cash - particularly if you are just looking for a continental style breakfast. In August, some restaurants can be closed for holidays, but although the hotel is in the business district of Madrid, it is near a metro stop and you can easily travel to the main restaurant areas around Plaza Mayor. Old Madrid and the area around "Sol" station are busy in the evenings with plenty of shops and restaurants. We booked a half day sightseeing tour of the city and Real Madrid's football stadium. Excellent and the bus picked us up at the hotel when we asked, which saved us having to go into the centre and wait at an underground bus station which would have ben difficult to find! A visit to the Palace is well worth it (only 8 euros each) and many rooms are open to the public, but get there fairly early as it gets busy with long queues to get in. In short, I would recommend this hotel for a quiet relaxing break and would stay again if I had the chance! Madrid is a varied and interesting city to visit for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jane245
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is a lovely hotel, we were upgraded on arrival. The room was lovely with a very comfortable room and large bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is about half an hour walk into the centre but the site seeing bus is ideal if you are here on leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A bit better than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Billyphx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel about 6 months before our trip and paid in advance to secure a better rate. Picking a hotel in Madrid was difficult because there are so many hotels in a wide geographic area that you could pick for different reasons. We ultimately chose the Intercontinental for a variety of reasons...Price, fimiliarity with the chain, and location. I'll address location first. We loved the location. It is off the beaten path but not so much that its a problem to get around. It is right on Castellana and 1 block to a metro station in either direction. It is maybe 2 km to the heart of the shopping (Serrano) district. The neighborhood is a high end quiet/charming residential mixed with a foreign embassy here and there. The streets are tree lined, pleasant and safe. Contrary to other reviews there are MANY dining options within walking distance. You really have to be willing to use the metro in a city like this to take advantage of convenience as well as an authentic experience. It is easy and cheap. We were bumped up to the Club level (room 635) and it was very nice. The room had a small sitting area that looked out over Castallana. The decor was very rich...Picture mid 80's trying to impress with gold colored fabric, blue accents, and dark hard wood. It was a bit dated for our tastes but none the less it was classic and clean. Well maintained. The linens were high thread count and exactly what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The only disappointments with the room were the TV (old and big) and the lack of a sound system for an ipod. The daily maid service was thorough and they do have turn down service as well. Service at the hotel was excellent. The concierge Alfredo Garcia was totally reliable and spoke perfect english. I would suggest that he actually made the hotel worth the trip. He reccomended several local dinning options that I would also reccomend (Wagaboo and Jose Luis as well as a pricier option IL Gusto). He also directed us to a place just outside of walking distance called IROCO that was quite exceptional (in fact its a must). We also arranged a tour of Toledo through the concierge. Also worth mentioning were the door men. There was one guy in the morning and one guy at night that were both very friendly and seemed interested in how your stay was. Very pleasant. Other services we used were the fitness center which was above average and the laundry service which was overpriced but totally convenient and did a good job. We had breakfast one morning and the prices were so outrageous that from that point on I ran across the street and 1 block north to Starbucks. We did not have any other meals at the hotel. I would definately stay here again, but before confirming I would explore two other places (Villa Magna and the Adler) that were closer and in our travels looked very nice. I think the one thing that this hotel and the other two I mentioned offer is a nice hotel without being in the heart of the busy city while still being close enough. We walked past the Ritz in our travels and it was too close to the tourist desinations and therefore very busy and noisey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, so-so location.”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here primarily because we had enough Priority Club points for 3 free nights. We've stayed at other Intercontinental Group hotels using points in New York, Amsterdram, Bruges, Brussels, San Francisco and Sydney. All of those hotels offered us upgraded rooms since we have platinum status, but this hotel did not. You have to book a deluxe room on the Ambassador floor to get access to the complimentary buffett and drinks, unlike the Crowne Plazas in New York and Amsterdam. The hotel itself is beautiful but on a very busy street with heavy traffic. Our room faced the street but noise wasn't a problem, it must have been well sound-proofed. The staff was very curteous and helpful. We arrived at 11:30 AM and our reserved king bed room wasn't ready yet. We weren't surprised since we were there before check-in time. The clerk offered us a queen bed or said she would get a king bed cleaned within an hour. We decided to wait and the room was ready when we got back from a walk. The room was clean and comfortable, with a large bathroom with a separate tub and shower, enclosed toilet and two sinks. Plenty of closet space. We didn't eat at the hotel as it was too expensive. The breakfast buffett was 32 euros so we went out. The location seemed more suited to business travel, with many office buldings nearby. There is a subway stop a few blocks away so it was easy to get to the various attractions but I would have rather stayed at a hotel closer to the Plaza Mayor and the old town. On the whole though, it was a very nice place and I would stay there again, especially if I could get a free room again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie_Grazielle
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my wedding at the Intercontinental Hotel and I must say that they have treated us absolutely wonderful from beginning to end. The staff was very friendly, the location is excellent and the food was wonderful. I have travelled a lot and stayed in many different hotels from 3 to 5 and I must say that this Hotel is in the top 3! Thanks again Intercontinental hotel for making our wedding and 3 night stay unforgettable!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wherever the cheap fares take me
Reviews.Title: “Otherwise great stay ruined by OUTRAGEOUS phone bill”
Reviews.Author: antonius66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 7 days from the end of May to beginning of June. Let me say that I was very pleased with my stay until the very end and would have given this hotel 5 stars across the board, were it not for the phone bill I received at the end of my stay. First off, the location is pretty good, as it is very close to a Metro stop and you can easily reach the rest of the city. It is right on the Paseo de la Castellana, so you are near the Prado and a few other sites. The rooms were nice, and I received a nice sized room. The decor is a little stuffy, but I liked it. The bathroom had a shower and seperate tub and 2 sinks, except the water pressure in the shower was terrible. I do not know if that was on purpose or if ours was not working correctly, as we never got around to asking. I used the shower head in the tub and it was fine. One thing that DID irritate me, was the desk calling every day at around 2 pm if we were still in the room with the "clean later" sign on the door, to ask what time they could come clean. I hate when hotels do that, and love hotels that leave you alone. Either tell me "if your room does not get cleaned by X time you will not have it cleaned today" or leave me alone until I leave, but quit bothering me every day. There were two nights where there was very loud music permeating the walls of the room coming from an unknown locale until about 2 am. I THINK it might have been a wedding or reception in one of the lounge rooms, but I could not be sure, as it was NOT coming from the street and not an adjoining room. The club lounge was very nice and provided a good breakfast if you have access to it. Very helpful and polite staff in the lounge. In fact, the hotel itself was filled with nothing but very polite and helpful staff. I did not encounter ANY rude people, as others have complained about. My main complaint was the outrageously overpriced use of the phone. I was charged 76 euros (about $111 at the rate at time of payment) for 12 minutes and 5 seconds worth of phone calls over 5 calls. 3 calls to the US for a total of a little over 5 minutes and the rest on 3 calls to a local spanish mobile phone. Seriously? I understand that I should have checked the posted rate they charge first, but I would never have expected in a high end, business hotel, that they basically would make it so you are afraid of touching the phone. It is not reasonable to expect that people in that type of hotel might need to make a call or two, and those prices are OUTRAGEOUS. The hotel is not paying anything even CLOSE to 4-6 euro a minute for those calls. That amounted to 10% of my total bill, for 12+ minutes of phone usage, more than half of which was 3 local calls. Needless to say, that pretty much ruined the stay for me, and lowers my rating to 4 from what otherwise would have definitely been 5 stars. I expect to be overcharged a certain rate for things in a hotel, but for phone calls that cost a maximum at the very most 10 euro total, to pay 76 is a outright thievery. I would return all things considered, but my sentiment towards the hotel is really ruined and I would certainly stay away from the phone at all costs and make sure I either get a cell phone or go to a pay phone on the street, because God forbid, I cannot use the phone in my room at an elegant 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God i was not paying for this myself.”
Reviews.Author: lollytipperary
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately choose this hotel and stayed for 6 weeks as the location was near my workplace, Thank god i did not have to pay for this myself as i would have definitely not stayed. The hotel feels as if they are doing you a favour by letting you stay. Rooms are terrible extremely small and outdated decor. Smelly Rooms. Breakfast was total carnage, as the breakfast room is small and people are running around the place like headless chickens, although i was there for a number of weeks they still did not even know my room number. Furthermore they pass off tap water as bottled water for breakfast. Laundry is a joke and extremely overpriced they do not wash it properly. The only people who i would have to say something nice about are the doormen/concierge who were always friendly and welcoming unlike there colleagues at reception. I had a "garden view room " yeah right- it looked over a concrete patio with a few flowers. Horrible view. Internet was an absolute rip off €24 for 24 hours no option for 1 hour and did not work properly

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Spanish people very rude”
Reviews.Author: SUZYBermuda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel throughout Europe on trains and planes. However our intrdouction to Madrid Spain was two immigration officials asking fo rour passports. When we produced EU passports they seemed a bit surprised. However after a bit of hesitation on one officials behalf they let us continue our journey as we had just embarked from the overnight Hotel Train from Portugal. We arrived at the Intercontinental Hotel, Madrid Spain as beautiful building in a tree lined district near the Embasseys in Madrid Spain. The hotel staff are very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is an excellent choice for a stay, although quite expensive and if you want clean, spacious rooms this is the place to go. But the food and drinks are very expensive therefore you have to venture outside the hotel for meals. Another problem is Spain does not have many non-smoking restaurants so beware of the smokers. We found one restaurant and used it as our dinner place for a few evenings. However once you go out into the street the local people are not friendly if you do not speak Spanish and even if you attempt to use high school spanish they are not impressed. We actually encountered haughty ladies in department stores where we had gone to get a new camera bag for my husand whose handle had broken. Nonetheless if you are travelling to Spain and speak very good Spanish you will be able to correspond with the locals. I am told by other Europeans that Madrid is not the place to visit, however, you need to visit Barcelona where the locals are courteous and used to international visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive and substandard service!”
Reviews.Author: wicketo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night with my grandmother. Room was upgraded to junior suite but we were given a smoking room instead of non-smoking. There was no odour in the room but at least the ashtrays (3) could have been taken away. Service in the club lounge was good but we decided to have breakfast downstairs for a little more space and variety. Big mistake as service there was nothing but terrible! Food was good, though, but the overall experience was probably my worst in an Interconti so far. Very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin1888
Reviews.Content: In general it is over priced and too far from the city centre. There are no restaurants in the vicinity and you have to take a cab/metro into town. Concierge/doormen are excellent. Reception staff friendly enough, however the general feeling is that they are doing you a favour by letting you stay there. The whole place left me underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Great International feelings at the Intercontinental in Spains Capital!”
Reviews.Author: Flyer007Dublin
Reviews.Content: We have just been back with easyjet from Casablanca and now we checked into the Intercontinental Madrid for one night at an Executive room no. 424 with superb Club Lounge access, Folks! After a 15 min. Taxi ride ( around 25 Euro ) we had checked into this fine hotel with magnificent welcome as they have waited the whole day for us! This was super, dooper! Check-in was in the Executive Lounge! Our room was medium to large in gold and cream colors and was very luxurious. Our welcome amenities included Olive oil and water and a handwritten note from the Hotel manager. Our view was just fantastic over the famous Paseo de la Castellana. Our double bed constituted two single beds. One of us was happy and the other clearly wasn' t! Guess who? The TV choice was superb incl. CNN and all other channels! The minibar was fully stocked and the room was very well furnished. The Bathroom had separate shower and bathtub and two sinks for him like me and her like the other one! The bath amenities have been from Elemis! Just superb! The towels have been embroidered with the Intercontinental Club Logo! We have indeed two bought from the hotel after calling one stop button on the phone for service! The towels came packaged in nice gift wrapping and an Intercontinental Madrid bag! We still have the bag and ahhhhh the towels! What had you expected dear reader? The Executive Lounge was and is superb, really really good! We had organic cava and fruits, nuts, ham and olives skewers, nice drinks, and to our surprise Chuppa Chups Lollies and very fine gelee fruits to eat! Mmmmmhhhh! The breakfast at the next morning was also a hit affair incl. fresh bread, fine meat, fruit salad, eggs, yoghurt, coffee specialities served at your table! Really nice touch! We enjoyed also Internet access at the lounge for free! On our evening we had roomservice with a super large portion of Valencia Paella for her and for me a pizza with ham and cheese which was all nice plus our dessert which was a also large portion of apple pie, more pie than one portion! There was one small complaint however, as some other reviewers have written about! It is the awful hot chocolate, which was in our case drinkable chocolate pudding! This was definitely not a usual fine drinkable hot chocolate in the sense we all know and enjoy! So Intercontinental THIS HAS TO CHANGE! FAST! Please now serve good drinkable hot chocolate with marshmallows and leave the pudding for desert and not for a cup! The Hotel has also a Spa, time too short for us! The service and friendliness were all top notch! We had also a drink at the BAR 49 in the hotel which was nice! The location of the hotel we found was very good within easy walking distance of many sites and strolling distance to Retiro. The Serrano Shopping district is also only around 10 to 15 min. away with many famous Luxury brand boutiques. All in all a super hotel with only one night which was tooooo short! Back to Dublin with Aer Lingus! Go Baby Go! Yes, Folks this is right!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations by a mile..er..kilometer or two.”
Reviews.Author: wehodavid
Reviews.Content: While visiting Madrid for a week on business, I selected this hotel because of its proximity to my office. Little did I know it was going to be such a great experience. Everyone was friendly and helpful, the room was incredibly beautiful, large and sparkling clean. I was upgraded to a Club floor which included breakfast each morning. As a long-time Marriott frequent guest, I can compare this to their "Concierge" floors and I can say that the Intercontintal wins and it's not even close! The location is between two metro stops so it's a short walk to either. I never had to wait for a taxi outside the front door. My only complaint is the cost of room service and maybe the lack of ice machines but these seem to be a common complaint with many European hotels. I give this one 5-stars!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but expensive...”
Reviews.Author: bas1st
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights here in a suite, which was nice, big, full of amenities and absolutely clean! Large bathroom with separate shower. The shower door didn't close entirely, so watch out when adjusting the angle of the shower head... You might ''overflow'' the rest of the bathroom :-) The only downside of the room might be the rather old, small and bulky tv's. Not what you expect in a hotel of this caliber. Luckily the room had airconditioning so the windows could remain closed, since it faced an extremely busy 6 lane road which looked more like a highway running directly through the centre of the city. As this hotel is 5 stars, you expect drinks etc. to be expensive, but € 8 for a coke excluding VAT is still outrageous imo! If breakfast isn't included in your room rate: walk a few minutes to get a sandwich at the supermarket in the basement of El Corte Ingles. The € 35 per person for the breakfast buffet isn't worth it. Large selection, but nothing special compared to other 4 and 5 star hotels. Room service is good and quick, but again very expensive (€ 15 for a ham and cheese sandwich). The staff in general is quite friendly but not everyone speaks English that well (what else's new in Spain...) so don't be surprised if you order scrambled eggs at breakfast and you get an omelette :-) Location is ok! It's not really near all the tourist sites, but a metro and bus stop is nearby. Public transport is quite clean and efficient so you can get everywhere in just a couple of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “They let you pay for everything”
Reviews.Author: tgv2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 days trip to the IC Madrid. Booked an IC clubroom but got at checkin an upgrade to a suite. Although being a 5 star hotel I don't understand why they ask € 8,56 for a beer, water or softdrink. They IC clublounge only offered limited food and drinks. Because the lounge doesn't have a refrigerator softdrinks are warm. Internet is only free for 1 hour per room. My conclusion is this hotel is overcharging.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel but pass on the hot chocolate!”
Reviews.Author: Laurence2208
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Modern, plush, spacious, imposing and most importantly well located. The room was fairly traditional, nicely proportioned and had a small balcony offering great views of the Madrid skyline (note: we had a high floor). The service was, on the whole, impeccable. However, I consistently had problems with staff in the restaurant (and there was no language barrier as I am fluent in Spanish). The breakfasts were totally sub-standard, the service poor at best, and on New Years day my hot chocolate, which arrived in a pot, tasted like meat and seemed somehow more watery than normal. To cut a long story short, the head waiter eventually admitted that I had actually been served left over gravy from the previous evenings New Years Eve banquet..............!!!!!!! You simply do not expect that kind of lapse in a hotel of this calibre and, while I saw the funny side of it, the restaurant staff were in general less finessed than those stationed elsewhere in the hotel. Overall, this hotel still gets a "thumbs up". Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Intercontinental Madrid”
Reviews.Author: mbdw
Reviews.Content: We've recently returned from a weekend in Madrid and were fortunate enough to have stayed at the Intercontinental. The hotel itself is very clean and the room we stayed in was fantastic. On returning from a shopping trip on our first day we arrived back in our room to find an ice bucket with a chilled bottle of Brut Cava, a box of chocolates, fresh strawberries dipped in chocolate and a welcome note. Nice touch. Later on that evening we were undecided as to where to go to eat so we spoke with the concierge who recommended a traditional Spanish restaurant and we ended up having one of the best steaks we've ever had. The doormen were polite, friendly and very helpful, in fact, every member of staff that we encountered in the hotel could not do enough to make our stay as pleasant as possible. With regards to location the hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from Serrano and Goya (excellent shopping areas). The breakfast was also very good. Being a five star hotel extras are not cheap - we paid 11 EUR for two bottles of still water in the bar. The weekend was a treat and you can't expect things to be cheap when staying in a five star establishment. We would highly recommend this to any person looking to stay in Madrid whether it be for a couple of nights or longer and whether for business or pleasure. All in all, a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Above average but not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kathysa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for 2 days in early April. The hotel was nice, but we had a room that overlooked the lower rooftop heating or a/c vents, so absolutely no view. We also had 2 twin beds pushed together, and I'm pretty sure that's not what I booked. The room and bathroom were very nice. Breakfast was excellent, but 69 Euros for the 2 of us each morning. It was quite a walk to get to the center of the city. If I were going back for sight-seeing, I'd try to find something a little closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in the IC Madrid”
Reviews.Author: HolyBoy
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Madrid is located on the Castellana, in short walking distance to Serrano luxury shopping area and within few minutes taxi ride to the centre of the city (Sol). It overlooks the busy street, but fortunatelly the room was completely soundproof. Upon request, seamless limousine airport transfers were provided. Staff are very kind and helpful throughout the hotel. There is an Club Intercontinental Lounge which is a pleasant spot and provides a nice selection for breakfast however otherwise the variety of refreshments available in the Lounge is rather limited compared to the other InterContinental hotel lounges I have been to. The Picasso Suite I stayed in was spacious, luxuriously furnished and very comfortable. The hotel building is not new but all areas seemed renovated and well kept. Only downside is that the hotel just has a small gym and no other wellness and relaxation facilities. They told me however that they are planning to open a new spa soon (?). Would definitelly stay in this hotel again espec as there are not many other luxury hotel options in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATL_Mommy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a regular room with a king-sized bed. The room was not huge by U.S. standards but the furnishings were top-quality and comfortable. The marble bathroom was very large with seperate tub, great selection of toiletries and big 100% cotton towels. Coffee machine, iron with full ironing board and other amenities in the room. The bed was amazingly comfortable with a feather pillow top and feather duvet - like sleeping in a soft warm nest. Elegant public spaces. City centre is about 20 minutes by taxi or shorter by metro; airport is about 20 minutes by taxi. Excellent service from the doorman, porter, and front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: pmp007
Reviews.Content: It's a business hotel in Madrid City Center. Service great. Rooms ok but with old fashion furniture. WC too small. Ameneties on average.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHart10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the this hotel in May 2006 and decided to return with our children in February 2007. This hotel is exactly what you expect from a 5 star hotel, the decor, sevice, food and rooms. We are Ambassador members of the Priority Club and we were checked in at the Club Lounge. The staff and service in the Club Lounge is excellent, they even remembered us from the previous year, nothing was too much trouble. We book a very large suite which was fantastic, the food was gorgeous. I cannot praise this hotel enough, fabulous, we will return soon. Madrid is a great city break, make sure you use the city bus, excellent value for money, we visited all the usual museums etc and of course the Madrid Football Stadium the children loved this. Would recommend Madrid and of course this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All around excellence - underrated in other reviews”
Reviews.Author: LoveGrandHotels
Reviews.Content: Booked a Club-level room and upgraded to a Junior Suite because I was a Platinum Ambassador. Room was large and well furnished. Large foyer with closets, living room, separate bedroom, and large bath with double sinks, separate tub, and shower (entire bath space was marble). Service was first rate from the doorman on up. Lovely piano player in the lobby each evening - they could have filmed one of their new commercials "Do you live the Intercontiental Life?" there - it would have been a perfect setting! Booked several tours through the hotel and all went without a hitch. Very walkable to everything for those that don't mind a 20 minute or so walk. Was really pleased with the location, as it was bit away from the tourist hustle and bustle. Two metro stops nearby also take you everywhere - and one of the cleanest metro systems I've seen. Club level amentities were great: hot breakfast, snacks throughout the day, champagne from 7am until 11pm (!!). Wine and beer available from noon unil 11pm. Hard liquor was at charge. My only minor complaint was that the all-day snack service was identical on all 4 days I was there. It would have been nice for them to change things up a bit - at least every other day. But don't get me wrong - for me, the Club level amentities were a GREAT value considering how expensive food and drink are in Europe due to the US Dollar-Euro exchange rate. Don't hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Adrianbudia
Reviews.Content: Very good and fast service, nice and polite staff, comfortable room...what i can say,,, fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: newyorkanya
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Intercontinental regularly on work trips and always lament that we are not at the Westin opposite the Prado or at the AC Mauro Santo. I have to say, however, that on our last trip we were really thrilled by the service. Everything was impeccable: restaurant reservations we had requested were done before we arrived, packages and plane tickets were waiting in our room when we got there. Check in was quick. And all was done with humor and good nature.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on business. Very nice hotel, when I originally arrived I wasn't keen on the location (corner of busy junction), however, the location grew on me. The hotel is well located with 2 metro stops within walking distance (Ruben Dario - 5-8 mins, Gregorio Maranon - 2 mins). You are only a few stops from the centre of town. There is also the ABC Serrano shopping complex (10 mins walk) and a Starbucks (3 mins) from the hotel. Restaurants are also not far from the hotel - 10 mins, just head towards ABC Serrano shopping and walk up the steps next to the overhead by pass. The gym in the hotel is small but does the job. Breakfast was very nice, albeit expensive - 26 Euros. Be careful of the grates on the floor as you enter the breakfast area if wearing stillettos.....I almost broke my neck when my heel got caught! Altogether, very nice, comfortable and exceptionally clean rooms. Free toiletries were the best I've had on a business trip and the sweets on the pillow were very nice too. Tip - there is a very nice tapas bar around the corner (to the left of the hotel as you walk out), food portions were huge for tapas, so don't order too much initailly else you'll have loads left :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not that nice”
Reviews.Author: Marie44
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby area but the rooms are small and dated. The bed linen looks very worn, old and dirty. Certainly not 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Concord Pit
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel. As intercontinental Ambassadors, we were upgraded to a club room. The Club floor checkin was extremely helpful, and we were greeted with a drink before being shown our room, which overlooked the garden/restaurant. The first night was raining, so we spent the night in the club lounge, sipping Cava and eating snacks, and felt completely at home, with first class service from the club lounge waiter. All aspects of the hotel were designed to make our stay a delight, and the hotel staff were simply wonderful, attentive, and their attention to detail was impressive. We ate at the restaurant on our final night, and the food was delicious, the many staff on duty were prompt, and fully deserving of the tip we left. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants luxury, comfort and enjoyment. Taxis to the coty centre are about 10 euros and from the airport about 25 euros depending upon traffic. The hotel is well placed for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: szabolcs17
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is very high-standard. I had booked a room for 3 nights straight (luxury weekend package) but had to interrupt my stay (2 + 1 nights) due to a rescheduled soccer game in Seville that I wanted to attend. When I called the Intercontinental reservation center, they told me this modification would not be possible to do, and I would have to pay penalties, along with higher rates. I later phoned the hotel directly and they modified my reservation immediately, with no extra charges. That was the first good sign about IC Castellana. Once at the hotel, everything went smoothly. Check-in was fast and efficient, the staff at the front desk was incredibly helpful and friendly. Contrary to some earlier reviews, I found no fault with the concierge either. The room (superior double) was spacious, facing Paseo de la Castellana. It had everything you would expect from a five-star hotel. Spotless, elegant, comfortable. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Breakfast was sumptous. Wide selection, including salmon, Iberian ham, and champagne. All requests (extra bathroom amentities, later checkout) were prompltly arranged. The location isn't bad either. Cabs cost around 5EUR to downtown Madrid, but there are two subway stations within walking distance too (Gregorio Maranon - 2 min. and Ruben Dario - about 5 min.). In about 40 minutes, you can walk all the way to Museo del Prado. All in all, a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: CWinTX
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough complimentary things about the Intercontinental Madrid Hotel. Every public area, from the lobby to the restaurant and bar to the fitness center and spa, was luxuriously appointed and immaculately clean. We reserved a room on the hotel's club floor. The package sold for 231 euros per night and included a one day Madrid card, which allowed for free access to Madrid's best museums. Our room was very large with a balcony overlooking the courtyard below. Our bathroom was huge with separate tub and shower and his and her sinks. The club area on the hotel's first floor (second floor to Americans) serves a full breakfast every morning until 11am. Wine, champagne and snacks are served throughout the day, with a number of great items available for tea from 5-7pm and hard liqour along with the snacks from 7-9pm. Every day you get one complimentary copy of a newspaper selected from a list of more than 300. I was able to read my hometown newspaper, The Washington Post, every morning over coffee, even though it was only 3 or 4am back in my hometown of D.C. - presumably just about when the newspaper came out. The service everywhere in the hotel, from the club lounge to the lobby and bar, was some of the best I've ever experienced. While most of the hotel seems to cater to high-end European businessmen and women, we were treated as equals, even though we were American tourists, speaking mostly English and not dressed in fine business suits each day. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an amazing experience in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant lobby and common areas but awful rooms”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel63
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Intercontinental with my wife and 2 children. We travelled with another family of four. We requested non-smoking adjoining rooms and our friends request was honored but our rooms were not adjoining. Our room and our children's room were very small, even for european standards with a view of the fire escape and dark internal courtyard. We had a king room which was about 2 feet wider then the king bed itself. It was dark and the beds were extremely firm and not comfortable. The bathroom was very small with only one sink but with good water pressure. Our room rate included breakfast which was excellent. The service was wonderful and the breakfast choices were very interesting and fresh. There was fresh fruit, bacon, sausage, omelets, pastries, lox etc. The concierge was erratic. One of them was helpful but the others spoke little english. The front desk was also of little help. When I asked to move rooms they would not change our room to a nicer room because our rate was too low for an upgrade. The location of the hotel was not too bad. It was a 15 minute walk to the museums or 5-6 euro cab ride. I must say after reading the great reviews on this website I was very dissapointed by the room size and quality. The lobby was grand and the breakfast 5 star but the rooms were way below expectations. Our friends adjoining rooms had a nicer view of the street in front of the hotel and they were a little larger. However they had two single beds and not a king as promised. I would recomend staying at a different place if I returned to Madrid. The Westin or Ritz would be a better choice. We stayed at this hotel because they had a half price special on the children's room and included breakfast but even with the discount I would probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calvados13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 5 night saty at the Interconinental. We had a wonderful time and the organisation and planning at this hotel left nothing to chance. We were met at the airport and delivered to the hotel with minimal fuss but maximum comfort. On arrival we were greeted by the duty customer relations manager who showed us to our room. I am an an Intercontinental Ambassador ( highly recommended as previous review) and we had been upgraded to a beautifully spacious club room with complimentary fruit, mineral water and local wine. The bathroom was especially nice. I cannot fault the staff at this hotel although I do have to agree with previous reviewers that the food in the hotel restaurant is not all it should be. Where I disagree is that the food we had from room service was beyond reproach (though expensive). I dont mind paying for quality and that was certainly the case during our stay. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GodErnst
Reviews.Content: I spent December 2005 up until Christmas in this hotel while on business in Madrid. The hotel itself is excellent - housekeeping/concierge/reception service was top notch, the room is spacious with an excellent bathroom and the fitness center is the best I've seen in Madrid (compared to the Villa Real, Crowne Plaza & other 5 stars). Best part was that at least from where I was staying you could pick up free (but faint) WiFi from somewhere downstairs and not have to pay the 20+ EUR/night fee. The quality of the food for room service I felt was lacking and was very expensive (but that's to be expected). The hotel is a very quick walk to the Metro stop which provides excellent access to the entire city by being on lines 8 & 10. There's not many sites/locations that are walkable (though a solid 10-minute walk will get you to good places to eat/shop) but as a business traveler it's central location makes it extremely convenient for accessing multiple sites.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable, But With Problems”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Matt
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay a this beautiful Hotel which is located in an excellent,quiet, location far away from the hubbub of the Gran Via area. Upgraded to a comfortable,Club Room at check-in and were very pleased with the services & breakfast offered in the Club Section. However,when compared to other Five-star hotels I found this property a little lacking. Firstly, food in the Dining Room was over-priced and quite frankly not that tasty. (After finding a sliver of glass in my soup after one meal we just could not dine there again!) Surprisingly, food from room-service was far better!!!Secondly, although housekeeping kept the room clean, each day we had to call to request some item/amenity they failed to replace. Lastly, and most frustating, was at check-out the Desk Clerk just did not seem to know how to process an American Express Travelers Cheque Card and we were overcharged 500EU. After THREE overseas phone calls back to the Hotel we are still waiting for a return-call,as we were promised,from someone on the Hotel Staff to resolve this problem. This Hotel is well above average and has many excellent qualities, but not quite Five -star in my opinion. Would stay here again but only after comparing rates at the two other Five-star hotels (Hesperia & Occidental) in this area.
